results.description:
STEAM education is crucial for K-12 students as they are learning and beginning to forge a path for their adult lives. STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Math) incorporates the 4 C’s – collaboration, communication, critical thinking and creativity, integral skills that are in high demand and are necessary to thrive in the 21st century workplace.

This Group will serve as a resource for educators and parents, of K-12 students, as well as researchers, professors, business professionals and others who are dedicated to making sure our students thrive in the 21st Century Workplace. Our Meetups will feature a variety of topics and speakers, demonstrations and sharing of ideas. We hope you will join us for lively discussions, practical information and brainstorming on how STEAM education can prepare our students for the workforce of the future.

This Meetup Group is hosted by Hofstra Continuing Education and LaunchPad Huntington.
results.name: STEAM Education: Inspiring Future Innovators

results.description:
This group is for anyone interested in improving their English conversational skills. The meetup group is designed to help members practice speaking in English with other students and native speakers.

Who should join: Anyone who is interested in improving their English conversational skills and make new friends in NYC is welcome to join. It doesn't matter how old you are, where you are from, or how well you speak English. Everyone is welcome, and we will support one another to speak English better. (This meetup is not open to native speakers or English teachers!!)

Why should members join: There are many English schools out there where students can learn the English grammar and composition. But what many ESL students want is an opportunity to practice speaking English more and better. Members will have that opportunity in the group. We offer 10 sessions of English speaking lessons in a semester at a studio in Midtown Manhattan. The instructor will help members to improve their English conversational skills.

What can members expect out of the group: The group will meet once a week on Wednesday nights from 7 PM to 8 PM. Members can stick around 15 to 20 minutes after class to hang out and ask questions. Even though the group will meet at a studio that is rented by the hour, all classes will be free of charge.

The group will also have outing events, such as going to famous restaurants in NYC, Broadway musicals, sporting events, and etc. Members will be able to make new friends from all over the world. Please message me if you have questions.
results.name: NYC English Conversation Meetup

results.description:
It is scientifically proven that people who laugh and have fun live longer. The older you get the harder it seems to meet women with similar interests who can be your "Girlfriends". So let's live Ladies! This is a social group for motivated, fun, positive women who want to build friendships and socialize with other like-minded women. The group will intentionally be small in order to cultivate personal and meaningful friendships. The emphasis is quality not quantity. ;-)

This group is all about doing the things we love and meeting new girlfriends in the process!

 **Reasons to Join the Group**:

1. If you are looking to meet women with a solid foundation who have similar interests (in the mid-30s to mid-40s age range).

2. If you like to socialize, try new things and meet people in the meantime.

3. If you are looking to meet real women minus the drama.

4. If you love to have fun!

5. If you have a zeal for life, an enthusiastic spirit, outgoing or shy, this group is for you.

Activities include, but are not limited to:

~ Taste bud Excitement: Group Dinners/Wine Tasting/Happy Hours/Girl’s Night Out/Brunch

~ The Great Outdoors: Walks/Fairs & Festivals/Shopping Days

 ~ Look Great: Fitness Excursions/Spa Day/Pampering

The possibilities are endless... your suggestions are important so "PLEASE" add all details in the suggestion box.

**If you'd like to join this group, we do have a few things we require **

1) A photo of yourself is required to join. It makes it very difficult to find each other at gatherings if there is no photo posted.

2) If you would like to plan an event, please contact the organizer of this group and she would love to discuss the details with you. However, please note the purpose of this group is to cultivate friendships and is not a target for soliciting goods or services through events. Anyone requesting to join the group with a 'business and/or marketing intent' will be denied (i.e., home-based business parties such as Tupperware, Candles, Jewelry, etc.). Thanks for understanding!

 3) Please RSVP 'Yes' for an event only if you're sure you're able to attend. Space may be limited and therefore some events fill up quickly. To that end, if you have (2) or more 'No Shows' (meaning you RSVP'd 'Yes' but never 'Confirmed' for the event or showed up), you will automatically be removed to the 'Wait List' for future events. In addition, please do not RSVP 'Yes' but add a comment such as 'more of a maybe'. If you do, your RSVP will be removed, or you too will be moved to the wait list.

4) Usually about (1) week prior to the event an email will be sent to those who RSVP'd "Yes" requesting that you 'Confirm' for that event. Please take a moment at that time to go to the event page, click on 'Update' (located next to the green GOING button) and add in comments section: 'Confirmed'. This step is important as most times an accurate headcount is needed to reserve a table. If you are unable to attend once that email is sent out, please kindly change your RSVP to 'Not Going'; it frees up space for another member that may currently be on the 'Waiting List' for that event.

 5) Inactive members will be removed.

6) Lastly, show up!! Don't be shy, come out, introduce yourself and most of all....have FUN!!!
results.name: Staten Island Ladies Friendship & Social Circle

results.description: Looking to get your TV script to the next level? NYC TV Writing Intensive Workshop is a group that will pair together like-minded aspiring TV writers into small, 5-person workshop groups that will meet weekly. Ideally, each group will have a like-minded focus. This is a very intensive, right-to-the-point group that will follow a three month syllabus (1st month: pitch, story beats, outline, Act 1, 2nd month: 1/2 of the script finished, 3rd month: final script finished) with deadlines, page counts, readings from screenwriting books and scripts, and edits. Each week the members will send each other their pages a couple before meet-up night, they'll print them out and read them on their own time, writing detailed edits, notes, and a write-up about the pages, as well as working on their own material. We'll then meet weekly to discuss with each other and do some voluntary readings of the scripts. This is for the most dedicated, hard-working, and passionate aspiring TV writers who have the time and availability to dedicate themselves to this group.
results.name: NYC TV Writing Intensive Workshop

results.description:
" Dancing is sometimes all the therapy you need"
Welcome to Our Belly Dance classes! 
WHERE? 540 Durie ave, Closter NJ 07624 (Ventura Dance Center)
WHEN? Every Saturday at 10 a.m. $15 per person
Belly dance as many experts say, is the oldest form of dance, having roots in all ancient cultures. It takes many different forms depending on the country and region, both in costume and dance style. New styles have evolved in western culture as its popularity has spread globally.
Belly dance is a low-impact, weight-bearing exercise, osteoporosis preventive and is suitable for all ages and fitness level. The dance is enjoyed and performed by women and men as well.
The dance often focuses upon isolating different parts of the body, moving them independently in sensuous patterns, weaving together the entire body. The body benefits from undulating moves that lengthen the spinal column and strengthen the abdominal muscles in a gentle way.
results.name: Closter Belly Dance Classes/ Belly Dancing Bergen County

results.description:
The group will review and discuss a Future Technology Predictions and Scenarios. How far will technology advance in 20, 30, even 50 years from now? How will it affect our lives? Here are some technologies and scenarios predicted by science fiction writers, futurists, technology experts, me and you. 

ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 

Intelligent machines The Singularity Computers that predict the future Original music from software/machines Computer mediators that resolve legal disputes Machines/robots given rights Planet sized A.I. machine I-bots, or AIs that exist only on the Internet Artificial animal intelligence Artificial Intelligence used as classroom assistants Ai sports (robots playing football) 

BIOTECH/MEDICINE 

Extended/eternal life Synthetic life Repairing/manipulating DNA Organ replacement Growing organs Designer babies Designer bodies Personalized drugs Gene therapy/manipulation Biostasis - Cryogenic sleep Human cloning Virtual/robot medicine Instant pain relief Bionic implants to allow for extreme strength Morphing of the human body Age reversal Creation of organisms Synthetic organs Enhanced senses Alteration of our bodies in superhuman ways Bionic limbs Never have to sleep or eat Use genes of other animals to implant in humans Artificial immune system Computer generated life - design a tree, generate a seed Creation of new animal and plant species by genetic manipulation Human/animal waste elimination Gene manipulation to change eye and hair color at the salon Cloning of extinct species A capsule that can be swallowed which will cure most diseases Instant hair color changer Cloning machines Genetically altered humans that can photosynthesize A new sense discovered, example eyes see a new type of wave, ears hear a type of wave.....another useful sense for humans Food as designer medicine 

BRAIN 

Download your memories/brain Complete digital record of your life Mind/emotion control devices Dream control devices Brain enhancement implants - memory, telepathy Transfer of information into the visual cortex or subconscious mind Artificial telekenesis - an implant to alter physical things with your mind. Brain Transplants Tapping into unused parts of the brain Download training experience, e.g., someone could be able to fly a jet or guide a submarine Memory/personality manipulation Increasingly bulging and Grays-shaped heads 

CHEMISTRY 

Replication and/or transformation of one chemical element to another Super lubricant Artificial spider silk Matter Reformation. (trash into food or plastic) Catoms, or claytronic atoms. Programmable matter 

CITY 

Megacities/entire world is one city Moving/floating/underwater cities Underground cities Cities/houses could be one huge organism which can repair itself Self-constructing buildings Anti-seismic buildings Vertical (skyscraper) farms Interactive Tourism 

INFORMATION

results.description:
The arch nemesis of "Casual Fridays." When you're new school and everyday is casual, we're your excuse. Dust off that suit or pull out that dress, and mark your calendar for the first Friday of every month! We pick a location in New York City, meetup, socialize, and have fun. Join us for a great night, the city awaits.


History

We started back in April of 2011 as a small, but dedicated group of professionals working at Sony Music on the Global Digital team. We created assets, built websites, and ran the online stores for some of the biggest names in Entertainment. Neither the Tech industry nor the Music industry require proper business attire for the 9 - 5, so we decided to take it upon ourselves to have a good reason to class it up once a month. Every month since we have held an event on the first Friday of the month and have grown to encompass people from a wide range of professions: doctors, lawyers, brokers... the list goes on.

Are you motivated, disciplined, ambitious, dedicated, and actively working toward your personal and professional goals? If not, do you want to be? If so, then this is the meet up for you. If you want to change your life, your outlook, your everyday experience and ultimately your destiny, first change your mindset. Make no mistake: every action starts in the mind first and if you put junk in you will get junk out! This Book Club is for everyone who wants to be someone. Regardless if you are a self-help junkie or you've never even finished a non-fiction book, you are welcome here. We want a diverse community of like minded individuals. The only requirement is the understanding that each member of this group takes on two roles: both student AND teacher. We all have something to offer and we all have room for improvement... Even you! Kendra

To all beautiful women of NJ who would like to learn how to walk and live gracefully : ) Every Saturday at 10 a.m. and Mondays at 8 pm at Ventura Dance Center:  venturadancecenter.net/dances/belly-dance/

Belly dance as many experts say, is the oldest form of dance, having roots in all ancient cultures. It takes many different forms depending on the country and region, both in costume and dance style. New styles have evolved in western culture as its popularity has spread globally. Belly dance is a low-impact, weight-bearing exercise, osteoporosis preventive and is suitable for all ages and fitness level. The dance is enjoyed and performed by women and men as well. The dance often focuses upon isolating different parts of the body, moving them independently in sensuous patterns, weaving together the entire body. The body benefits from undulating moves that lengthen the spinal column and strengthen the abdominal muscles in a gentle way.
results.name: Graceful Movements Belly Dancers !

results.description:
Are you an English speaker starting a business, working or looking for work in or around NYC? Are you interested in improving your business communication skills? Perhaps you need to improve your Presentation Skills? Meeting Skills? Negotiation Skills? Networking?


If you're truly serious about improving your Business English / Business Communication Skills, this group is for you. There will be various events hosted during the month to effectively improve your business communication skills in the workplace, whether it's your listening, reading, and speaking skills. Once a week for 2 hours, you'll be able to practice english for the purpose of work and receive instant feedback & advice. Building confidence is the key to new levels of success. Looking forward to meeting you at an upcoming event.

Why business English? 
The skills needed to effectively communicate in business are the same skills that'll improve the quality of your work, relationships, and life. 

Focused on improving: 

Listening, Reading, and Speaking 

This group is lead by a native English Speaker and experienced TEFL certified instructor who will guide you to better improve your business english for work. 

OUR REGULAR EVENTS ARE:

Business English Conversations (FREE - $5 for material provided) - Every week on Sunday or Saturday.

Business Book Discussions (FREE - $5 for material provided) - This event is once a month.

Business English Career Series (FREE - $10 for material provided) - This event is twice a month.

If you are interested in an event, but do not see it listed on our calendar, send me an message.


"The best education you can get is investing in yourself." 
- Warren Buffett
____________________________________________________________________________________________ 


BUSINESS ENGLISH CONVERSATION  - (THIS EVENT IS FREE!) 

We'll be using TED Talks, case studies, and various business related articles & topics to improve your listening, reading, and speaking skills. Once a week for 2 hours, you'll be able to practice Business English for work and receive instant feedback & advice.

Materials: TED Talks, case studies, handouts, and business related articles & topics (Will be announced in scheduled meetup)

Time: 1:30pm - 3pm 

Date: This event is repeated every week.

Place: You can check our Meetup page for the address and directions.

RSVP: Seating is on a first come, first served basis whether you have RSVPed or not, so we suggest arriving early.

BUSINESS BOOK DISCUSSION

We'll focus on books written by leading thinkers in Business Strategy, Leadership, Communications, Marketing, and Personal Performance. This meetup will discuss the groups' insights; as well as, ways to implement new skills and strategies into our business careers.

Materials: Will be announced in scheduled meetup.

Price: This event is $5.00.  

Time: 6 - 7:30pm (Weekday)

Date: This event is repeated every month.

Place: You can check our Meetup page for the address and directions.

Read => Discuss => Take Action => Succeed! 


BUSINESS ENGLISH CAREER SERIES!

This is an Intensive Business English Workshop for those who are interested in the Financial Service Industry.  You do not have to be a financial professional in order to join this meetup event! Business English Learners who are interested in learning how to talk about money, finances, are allowed to join this workshop.  We cover common Financial conversations, how to effectively communicate in meetings, financial terminology/idioms used, and business concepts that are specific to the English language.  You are allowed to bring any materials and books that you would like to discuss. 

Price: This event is FREE. There will be material provided - value of $10.00.  

Time: 6 - 7:30pm  (Weekday)

Date: This event is repeated every month.

results.description: This is a group for people who want to explore metaphysical issues in Analytical Philosophy. The analytical tradition is distinct from Continental Philosophy in that it is more oriented towards accuracy and precision of language in its arguments. Analytical Philosophy encompasses topics including ontology, philosophy of mind and ethics. This group is primarily focused on Ontology and as such, will explore philosophy of mind and potentially ethics but only from the perspective of what exists. Normative issues and debates are not for this group. We will be primarily concerned with the philosophy of physics, nature and science generally. Issues such as the nature of time and space as well as what makes an object real, continuous and distinct (or not) are all focal points here.

results.description:
Welcome! 

Do you wish to be part of a beautiful community of like-minded souls on a personal journey of transformation? Come join us, shine your Light as we focus on our spiritual development, self-healing, joy and self-empowerment from a mental, emotional, physical and spiritual perspective. Our focus will be on energy transmissions, activations and guided meditation. Experience a connection to the higher realms of unconditional love for a journey of spiritual awakening and healing.

About Rachel & Circle of Light U.S.

I experienced much wonderful transformation during Meetups with The London College of Spirituality (LCS) and Circle of Light, London, both as a participant and a volunteer. Now in the US, I miss my spiritual community, the joy and the group energy created when we met.

I began meditating 15 years ago and was always interested in advancing my spiritual development, completing my Reiki Master attunement in 2009. I trained in Damien Wynne’s Light Grids after experiencing profound shifts related to mind, body and spirit during energy transmissions with Vaz Sriharan from LCS.

Following a spiritual path, especially if you have recently 'awakened' has the potential to present interesting challenges. Choosing to advance with self-healing usually means working through your life lessons. Being part of a community not only provides support but it can accelerate your spiritual development as you relate with like-minded souls.

By coming to Circle of Light you are instrumental in creating a group energy. Your commitment to healing through energy work not only impacts on you but on those around you and the planet, as you raise your vibration. I look forward to meeting you, to hear about your journey and to share these beautiful energy transmissions.

What to expect at the upcoming Meetups

We hope to provide a beautiful, calm space to be together, meditate, find stillness and joy - or whatever you need right at that moment. We will allow our higher selves and the higher realms, with their unconditional love, to work with us. You may be familiar with Reiki which is purely hands on. Energy transmissions enable us to receive universal energy (Reiki, Divine Light, chi etc) both as a group and individually as it is channelled directly into the space.

You do not need to have any prior knowledge of meditation and will be guided throughout the experience. All paths are welcome.

You always receive exactly what you need for your soul growth at the perfect time. You are never given more than you can handle - despite the fact it does not always feel that way! Love is the key to all existence. Love is also the key to healing all dis-ease.

Blessings on your journey!
results.name: Circle of Light U.S. @ Mondo

results.description:
Seasonal group since I don't ride under 50 degrees lol Just looking for a group of local riders who may not be able to plan that far ahead because - life happens! So if you are free ahead of time  or want to plan a last minute ride because you didn't realize how warm it is outside, and you want the company then put up a meetup. Let's just get out the house and ride. 

Ride Durations/Type - So many ride for work so let's do a ride for pleasure. Rides can range from 30 minutes to 2 hours+. Personally, after 90 minutes I need a break... this group is open to all motorcycle types such as canam, slingshots, sportbikes, cruisers, etc . Group good for folks that don't want to always push 150mph on the highway but okay with a highway range of 60-100mph (depending on traffic/weather) and residential less than 55mph of course. Group good for riders who just want to cruise down the GSP, local roads and take advantage of the weather since it's cold up here more than hot. Face it... we're not in Sunny California. So any day over 60 degrees I'm on my bike, even if it is just to the gym. 

I love riding to Bear mountain... have you been!! Nice easy ride. Looking for others to give ideas and share where they ride to. This is for the general area of North Jersey, Central Jersey, Parts of upstate NY (like Rockland county),  couple NYC rides (if we're brave enough to dodge the pot holes and traffic/rare). Don't want to suck up your whole day, just a couple of hours. I get cold easily so most rides that I plan will be in the early afternoon when the sun is the hottest. Once summer hits and it's over 65 degrees by 7am....  I'm all open to morning rides when the cars aren't out yet. When you plan/host a meetup, you can make it whenever. If you want to do a Waffle house run to Bethlem, PA (45-60 minutes) I'm always up for that run.. straight shot!

Come to a last minute meet up or host a meetup yourself. Be sure to enable email notification since this group is all about last minutes or check our twitter @njlastminriders. I'll try to post on twitter as the meetups come up... i'm not great with twitter but i'm working on it.

Group requirement - If you have a motorcycle endorsement on your VALID license then you can ride with us. Must have valid license, registration and insurance when riding in this group. 

Meetup Dues - Anyone who rides can join and post meetups. Dues are $3 annual. Which is to cover the monthly meetup fees I get hit with. Plus only serious riders who actually ride won't mind the $3 which is less than a tank of gas for your bike.  Don't want to be one of those groups with a bunch of members but only 3-4 people go on rides. Please don't add this group just to be a member. You need to actually participate even if it's only one ride. 

Why was I removed from the group?  If you sign up for a ride and are a "No show" instead of removing yourself from the RSVP then you will be removed from the group after the third "no show". This group has a total group max of 50 people. Don't want to be a huge group like other meetups just want serious people that ride. There is a two week trial for this group then $3 dues are due to remain in this group. If you find yourself too busy to participate please remove yourself from group, so others can join. Thanks. 

 Let's do this! #Letsride


Follow us on twitter for last minute rides that we too lazy to post on meetup lol 

Twitter  @njlastminriders

Facebook  https://www.facebook.com/NJLastMinRiders/

Be safe out there - always!!
results.name: NJ Last Minute Motorcycle Ride Meetup

results.description:
Cashflow 101 & 202 are educational board games, created by Robert Kiyosaki, the author of "Rich Dad, Poor Dad". 

The game teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time - yet it does NOT feel at all like classroom learning; it makes learning fun! 

You'll learn: 

- the difference between an asset and a liability; 

- how to make your money work for you (not the other way around); 

- how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the financial FastTrack. 

- You'll be amazed to see how the game reflects how you manage your own finances. 

Bring your family and friends for fun and learning at the same time. If you've never played Cashflow before, you’ll love it! Join us for a relaxed, casual, and fun time! 

We meet on the 3rd Wednesday, every month, at 6:30pm 

We are a group of local Stock Market Investors/Traders, Entrepreneurs & Real Estate Investors. The purpose of this group is to be with like-minded folks as we improve our know-how in the area of Financial Literacy, our Stock Market knowledge, and our Real Estate knowledge... the objective is to help change lives in the real world. 

Please note: CASHFLOW is a registered trademark of CASHFLOW Technologies, Inc. Cash Flow Tribe Cashflow 101 Meetup is not affiliated with CASHFLOW Technologies, Inc. nor The RichDad Company.

results.description:
I love when projects are in “development”, because that is often a time about personal development – when we have to get clear on what we believe and what and how we want to communicate to others.   Making a film involves so many skills.  One of the most important skills is being able to communicate your ideas clearly and in an engaging way, whether through your storytelling or through your pitch when trying to raise support to make a film.   This meetup is about providing a place for beginning low/no budget* filmmakers and scriptwriters in the Bushwick/Williamsburg/Ridgewood/Bed-Stuy area to pitch their projects in development and read their short scripts to get feedback and support.  

I taught a Make a Film Class Series at NYC College of Technology’s Continuing Ed for five years, and an introductory scriptwriting class at various locations for over ten years, as well as working and consulting on numerous small guerrilla film shoots.  

I have been accustomed to teaching in academic classrooms, crowded community spaces, and small rooms above bakeries.  I'm thrilled that Chez Bushwick Studio, a beautiful high-ceiling rehearsal hall with big windows and wood floors, where many movement artists have rehearsed experimental works, is allowing me to run this meetup there.  

I  want to help establish a community platform to help beginners get beyond themselves and their immediate networks for feedback and support.   I hope to find others who also want to create this.

(*Low/no budget means $0 to $10,000 cash budget, and scripts 1 pages to 15 pages.)
results.name: Film Project Pitches and Short Script Readings in Bushwick

To that we say: F-IT! Seriously, eff that! We believe fitness is about more than just looking good. Fitness is about moving well; being able to run, jump, and play; feeling good; and yes, enjoying your body and how it looks. We aim to help you achieve this not by convincing you to make yourself smaller, but to learn to live in your body and revel in all the amazing things it can do! Join us for some fun!

results.description: Systema builds its foundation on the principles of the physiological systems of the human body. The four major principles of study are Breathing, Relaxation, Structure, and Movement. Instead of teaching various techniques for various situations, Systema focuses on methods that develop movements that are explosive, effortless, spontaneous and unpredictable all while remaining free of excessive tension or emotion- the hallmarks of a true professional. The result is highly efficient, practical martial application that is both unpredictable and explosive. There are no competitions, no belts, no forms to memorize, or traditions to follow. Instead we focus on examining ourselves, the extent of our limitations, and to see how proud and weak we really are. Systema is also known by another name "poznai sebia" or "Know Yourself."
results.name: Systema Martial Arts

results.description:
Exhibitionists who don't know how to draw. Artists curious about exploring public nudity. Gay/Straight. All those who seek a free and encouraging environment to explore the human form. You will learn something. You will make a friend. Come with a mind open to new experiences. This is a safe space. 

No cover - Donations greatly appreciated 

RSVP - space is limited 

1) What IS Naked Drink n Draw? 

*** It's an immersive study in figure drawing while under the influence. In short, you get naked, have some drinks, and draw each other. Sound fun? It is! I will generally start off the night as the first model. After that, we take a volunteer from the pool of artists. We'll continue to take turns as models while everyone else draws. The parlor will be set up for drawing, the work room will be set up for painting, and if enough people are in attendance, the bedroom may be made available for additional drawing space.

2) I can’t draw... 

*** I can't draw either. It's not about that. Nobody's going to laugh at you if you suck. You could be god awful, but you may find you're better than you think. I can guarantee you won’t be the only shitty artist in the room. Besides, the only way to improve is with practice, and what better way to learn?!

3) Are the drawings judged? 

*** There will be a period at the end to critique each others' work, but nobody has to participate. No obligations to share your work. If you are comfortable with your work being photographed, I would like to post it on the group pages.

4) How much is it? 

*** It’s free! Of course, tips are greatly appreciated for snacks and supplies. It's normally $20 each but, if you can't afford it, we won't let that keep you from participating. it's called "struggling artists" for a reason.

5) Can I model? 

*** You are more than welcome to model. Take turns! Ideally, if we're all naked, we all stand an opportunity as model if we so desire. The only rule I have is you must be nude to pose. That is sort of the point, after all.

6) What do I bring? 

*** Bring supplies and booze. I will provide some supplies for those without, but I'm afraid I can not supply free booze. But hey, tip generously and I'll think about it ;P

7) Can I take photos? 

*** Nope. You can draw pictures, but you can’t snap them. Why, you might ask? It's kinda creepy, in a room full of naked strangers, to pull out your camera. Even if you ask, putting one "No" on the spot in a room full of "Yes" is the sort of intimidation and alienation I'm hoping to avoid. Respect this rule, please. Don't be a creep.

8) Who can come? 

*** Anyone! with some conditions 

-If I do not know you, and we have never spoken, shoot me a message first. 

-If you want to bring a guest or three, let me know. 

-If you want to come but not get naked, you better be the life of the party. 


9) Anything else I should know? 

***This is a safe space with supportive people and a free and encouraging energy. While people will be naked, don't just assume that's license to read someone's ass like it's brail. Please be respectful, consensual adults. If you start to creep people out, you leave. Also, please be quiet in the stairwell. My neighbors are real sweet people, you guys. 


10) Where is it? 

*** Ocean ave at Parkside Ave in Brooklyn. Parkside ave Q stop. Three buildings from the subway, on Ocean, across from the park. 


11) My boyfriend is not comfortable with me coming to this thing. Is this a sex party? 

*** This is my home. Keep sexpectations to a minimum, and know the line between sex and sexy. We also have couples come to every event. If your significant other is jealous, bring them! That said, if anything grows while you pose, don't sweat it. Appreciate it.

12) How many people will be there? Will it be crowded? 

*** I'm saying maximum capacity is 30. Won't be crowded.

13) What kind of poses are we doing? 

*** ENTIRELY up to you. You can go anywhere from Venus De Milo modesty to spred out and comfy. We're just naked people sketching naked people. For the first few hours we'll be working with short poses. After that we'll move on to longer poses. You can do couple/group long poses or individual 10 minute poses. 

If you have questions feel free to call or text me at 347.409.1220
results.name: Naked Drink N Draw (NDND)

results.description:
What if being part of a sisterhood where you are inspired daily to learn from each other and consistently given the tools to succeed from experts made all the difference in your life and your businesses? You’re not alone! What if your best friends were the smartest, sweetest, lady bosses around?  Would they hook you up with their business connections, share tips, knowledge and mastermind with you to help you up-level your business? If that sounds like an answer to prayer, then you my friend, are in the right place.

Lady Savant Society is a sisterhood and a business camp where fabulous lady bosses up-level their skills, connect and build real friendships. Haven’t you ever wanted a safe place to be an unapologetically awesome, winning woman?  We feel like every woman deserves that safe place.

Our mission is to inspire and empower women to turn their businesses and ideas into successful realities by providing a platform for women to learn, connect and collaborate. We are all in this together!  If you thrive off of  surrounding yourself with other like-minded, positive, enterprising  women who are in it to win, then you’re in the right place. CLICK on this video below to learn more:  

https://vimeo.com/154476912

We hope you come try out a "Savanting Circle" and see what the fuss is all about!  What is a Savanting Circle?  Savanting Circles are a safe place to brainstorm, share ideas, ask questions and grow in a group of motivated, trailblazing ladies like yourself.  I promise you will love it!  We are looking forward to meeting you!  

You can find out more about us at www.ladysavant.com and be sure to join our on-line Face Book Business Lounge here:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/LadySavantL...

results.description: Unity of New York is a joyful and vibrant ministry created to celebrate the Truth that all people are created with sacred worth. UNY began in 1999, and quickly grew to become a thriving spiritual community in the Unity Worldwide movement and remains so today in the heart of New York City. Unity of New York is led by spiritual director and music minister, Rev Britt Hall. Unity is a positive path for spiritual living that provides practical teachings to help people live healthy, prosperous and meaningful lives. We honor all paths to God as we provide a philosophy that is spiritual, not religious; and love-based, not fear-based. We strive to help individuals have a stronger connection to God every day by helping them to feel empowered, accepted, loved, inspired and connected. Every follower of Unity principles (sometimes referred to as Truth Student) is free to believe what he or she chooses about God/Spirit and our place in this beautiful and abundant universe. However, there are five concepts that Unity holds to be basic tenets: 1. God is Absolute Good. We don’t believe God is a mean and vindictive man in the sky waiting to punish us for failing. God is found within our very being as Love, Peace, Joy, Wisdom, Light, Life and Perfection Itself. These God qualities are available and accessible to all of us at any moment when we simply go within to where our Creator resides. We believe that there is only One Power and One Presence in the universe and in our lives – God the Good. 2. Since God is Good, then all of us, as God’s creation, must also be good. We do not believe in the concept of Original Sin; we believe that we have been created in Original Blessing. You are God’s wonderful, perfect offspring at this very moment, even if you have forgotten that Truth. God cannot create anything less than Itself. Jesus, our great Teacher and Elder Brother reminded us: “You are gods” (John 10:34). However, to access the fullness of this Truth, we have to awaken to it and become a co-creator with God. 3. We access God’s wholeness, prosperity, peace of mind, and joy by transforming our thoughts, words and actions from negative, limiting, and defeatist, to positive, joyful and optimistic ones. We are responsible for the kind of lives we lead, regardless of what life has been up to this point. When we change our thoughts/beliefs, we change our lives. 4. Through affirmative prayer and meditation, we experience God within us. When we take time during the day to turn everything over to Spirit, we receive exactly the right information needed to make our lives work. We must take time daily in silence for the renewal of our minds, souls and bodies. 5. Knowing these Truths intellectually isn’t enough; we must implement them daily – for the realization of our Oneness with God, and to be a blessing and of service to others. Scripture tells us, “Faith without works is dead.” With joyful enthusiasm we make life a great adventure, and we (and others) are blessed beyond measure by the creative use of these Truth principles.  For more info please chck out our web site at: unityofnewyork.org
results.name: Unity of New York~Spiritual Center Sunday Service

results.description:
Hello Everyone! I am a Registered Dietitian Nutritionist who specializes in Reproductive Wellness, Sports Nutrition and weight loss/weight gain/weight management. I am creating this group for 2 reasons. 1) To provide a setting in which people can help one another since many of you may have or be walking in the others shoes, as they saying goes, and can offer some insight. 2) I love what I do, and I want to branch out from the traditional office. This is a small group meeting weekly in which we will discuss a variety of health topics of concern from the group such as weight loss, PCOS, diabetes, training for a sporting event, etc.

The Details:

Location: Either in Los Angeles or in New York City

Meetup Costs: $10 per person.

Costs are part of my services as I can assist with issues pertaining to weight loss/gain/management, etc. This is NOT a 1-on-1 private session, and if you are interested in seeing me for a complete nutritional assessment I will be happy to speak to you about that after the  meetup. I see clients in person and on a HIPAA compliant platform :) No pressure though to sign up for anything. 


Note: You do not have to speak about any of your own issues and you may join just to listen or meet others. However, if you do decide to share you must be understand that this is a casual group setting and not a private setting.
results.name: Walking Nutrition

results.description:
We started our first meetup group in San Francisco back in March 2012.  It now has over 7,500 members (15,000 in all the Bay Area).  With the success of our events, we're expanding to the East Coast!

Our goal is to provide a fun low-pressure environment/activity where singles can meet, mingle and socialize together, without feeling like a third leg - like you do when you hang out with couples. Singles can hang out with other singles in a casual non-threatening environment. We just want to help singles get out and enjoy life while they are single. This also provides a more organic way for singles to meet. 

There is no age requirement for our group, except that you're over 18 of course. Our members range from 20 to 70 y.o. We're all about making friends first and enjoying the company of others and doing wonderful activities throughout Northern New Jersey and the surrounding areas. Cool couples are welcome to attend our great events as well.

VOLUNTEERS WANTED!

To keep our events low cost or FREE, we ask for volunteers to organize and host events. It’s easy: (1) choose an activity that you would like to do and pick a day & time to do it (at least 2 weeks in advance please), (2) determine where to meet and how people can find you once they get to the location (e.g. bring balloons, wear a loud Hawaiian shirt, or bring name tags, etc.) Then send us all the details and we’ll post the event to the group, (3) show up at least 15 minutes early and if there’s food or drinks involved, let the staff know that you have a meetup group coming and everyone is doing separate checks (estimate 50% attendance).

Benefits to volunteers: (1) you get to do the activities you want, when you want to do them, (2) you will attract the people who enjoy the same activities you do, who live/work near you and/or who have a similar work-play schedule that you do, and (3) you will meet and mingle with a lot of people as everyone looks to the organizer/host to lead the group. Most volunteers don’t stay single for long. So don’t hesitate to contact us, the group organizers, if/when you’re ready to host an event.

Cheers!
results.name: Do what you love, North Jersey! Singles Meetup Group

What if you could have a brand that attracts all the things you truly want in life: a great career, money, a great relationship/marriage and the confidence to be seen as a expert in your field?

results.description:
Yoga Classes @ Cooper Park <br>Open Level Vinyasa <br>Mondays, 7:30-8:45am <br>Dress for weather, bring your mat <br>￼

<br>￼ Investment: <br>7 classes (May 2-June 13) $105 <br>Drop-in class $17

About the classes: <br>Please arrive 5 min before class begins. <br>We cover a full spectrum of asanas accompanied by precise alignment cues and hands-on assists. Breathwork, mindfulness and meditation complement the physical practice. <br>Complete beginners and seasoned yoga students can practice side by side, as variations are offered to suit everybody's needs. Please spread the word through your networks! <br>￼ Teacher Bio: <br>It began seven years ago as I looked in awe at my friend as she balanced on nothing but her hands. I was from a small, homogeneous town, yoga seemed exotic, and I was competitive. "I need to learn to do that," I thought, and then signed up for my first yoga class. However, what started out as an interest primarily in the physical aspect of yoga (asana) gradually and organically expanded. I noticed yoga seeping into my everyday life, and the results were positive. I taught as an apprentice in Buenos Aires in 2013 and later received 200 hours of training at Jai Yoga Arts, 30 hours at Karma Kids, and continue my studies through daily asana and meditation. I consider my practice to be a 24-hour endeavor, and encourage my students to apply the lessons they learn on the mat to lead more peaceful, aware and joyful lives. In addition to my yoga training, I have studied Rolfing/Structural Integration through international apprenticeship and workshops, and offer sessions privately. In my classes you can expect to be challenged, yet supported with precise anatomical cues and hands-on adjustments.
results.name: Brooklyn Yoga Williamsburg

results.description:
Do you have a shadow life which only exists in your head and maybe on craigslist?  Well, join the club.  This group is a judgment free zone where you can talk freely about relationships, sexuality, fetishes, body image and identity issues, anything really, with a group of people who are there to do the same.

We're all fascinatingly different with regard to the particulars, but very much alike in the way we go through a lot of the same stuff.  Figuring out what we want, how to satisfy that nagging feeling inside and trying to navigate the craziness of craigslist or whatever.

This group will be fueled by honesty, integrity, trust, respect and shared humanity on the part of each participant.  With those qualities in abundance, it can surely be rewarding and a lot of fun.

The content is basically anything goes, but to distinguish this from a sex or fetish party, it will operate as a succession of presentations.  We'll call each one a Presenter.  After getting acquainted and selecting a random ordering of Presenters, one by one each will have the opportunity to address the group and have its full attention.  It may sound a little nerve wracking, and it very well may be, but that goes with the territory.

The job of the participants will be to help each Presenter feel comfortable and supported as they attempt to work out whatever it is they need to work out, even if they don't quite know it themselves.  It is extremely difficult to shed our defenses and be in the world without the safety of the masks we typically wear.  At the same time, not being our true selves wears us down and robs us of living life fully.  Most of us wish we could let our inner selves break free.

That's what this is about.  Important to state, all this nice, touchy, feely talk doesn't mean that the content will be all nice and touchy feely.  Quite the contrary.  Who knows what kind of "crazy" shit we're into?  Sadism or masochism, exhibitionism or voyeurism, other fetishes, compulsive masturbation, we may feel miserable about our physical appearance, feel lonely and isolated, or just maybe a wee bit repressed.  Any kinds of generalizations belie the true diversity of the dynamic individuals we all are and what makes us tick.

Want to come and find out?  Discover yourself in someone else's vastly different journey?  Talk about things you've never been able to reveal to friends and family?  Express things you are so ashamed of you feel the world will come crashing down, only to find acceptance, comradeship and helpful feedback?

Well, then maybe you should be part of this group.

Some people may be sensitive about subjects they consider gross or taboo, so as a participant you're just going to have to know yourself well enough to decide whether this is for you.  Presenters may place themselves in very vulnerable positions, so we will all need to respond with a reasonable balance of honesty and support. 

As a Presenter, you'll be free to go wherever this takes you, but refrain from crossing boundaries that might destroy the ability of the group to function.  No outright hostility toward other participants, for example.

Everyone must agree to treat the things that occur with COMPLETE DISCRETION AND CONFIDENTIALITY. This cannot be over emphasized.  Needless to say, no recording of photography will be permitted.

On the subject of nudity, it is completely acceptable on the part of each Presenter during their presentation.  Not required, but not at all prohibited.  The freedom to be our true selves in the physical sense may play an important role in helping us expand the dynamic range and quality of how we relate to others.  Sure, we'll still have our defense mechanisms there to fall back on, but at least our body language will be just that---body language!  Nudity purely to shock would probably be frowned upon, but as a means of feeling completely accepted as we are, may be vital.

Any form of sexual contact between participants would not be allowed, again to keep this within the bounds of focusing on the individual Presenter and what they are trying to work through.  As far as what is permissible behavior by a Presenter, they should feel free to talk, to move, to express emotion, to disrobe, to touch themselves, dress up however they wish, use sex toys, whatever it is about themselves they want to put out before the group.

This full range of expression is very important.  For example, a Presenter who is troubled by a certain compulsion they continually seek to satisfy without success may gain insights from acting out this compulsion before a supportive group that might not be possible otherwise.  Sort of getting out of your head and into your body and the real world.  Another Presenter may just truly need to feel they are being seen for who they really are.  Each will have to figure out for themselves where to draw the line between self indulgence and self examination.  Reflecting on what takes place, how did it feel, how did other participants react?  These discussions could be very rich indeed.

Meetings would take place in a comfortable private residence in Brooklyn.  All are welcome and a diverse group in terms of age, orientation and gender is hoped for.  Many details still to be ironed out.  Please contact with comments and questions.  Thank you for reading!
results.name: Brooklyn Body Image/Personal Fantasy Support Group

results.description:
Looking for woodwind and brass players interested in getting together to start a HORN CIRCLE!

What is a horn circle? Just like it sounds – it’s basically a drum circle, but for wind players. How does it work? Well, just like a drum circle, there are no formal rules. However, the participants generally approach it with a common understanding of what it’s about …

• All are welcome -- all ages, all skill levels.

• Participants can drift in and out both within a session and from week to week.

• We’re all there because we love music, and we’re seeking a collective, supportive atmosphere that encourages listening and learning from each other rather than competition and cutting.

• Finally, and most important, it’s all about improvisation. There are no arrangements or orchestrations. Nobody leads the session or tries to organize the group to learn tunes in common for the next session. There’s not even any need for talking about how to start when the session begins -- you just show up, join in, and play what you feel ... • 

Now, it does need to be said that horns are very different than drums, and it might not be possible to spontaneously get a coherent sound like they do in a drum circle. If nothing else, maybe we’d need to talk about what and how we’re going to play before starting, right? Well, yes, some talking would facilitate the process – and since there are no rules, there definitely wouldn’t be any rule against approaching it this way. On the other hand, though, an approach based on not discussing anything beforehand might be worth trying precisely because it is more challenging.

Anyway, those types of details can be worked out. At this point, we’re just trying to gauge the level of interest and reach some people who might want to be involved. In terms of logistics, the venue will be somewhere outdoors (still to be determined -- Central Park? Prospect Park? Under the Williamsburg Bridge?) and we’re hoping there are enough people interested so that we can make this happen once per week throughout the Summer.
results.name: NYC Woodwind / Brass Improviser's Circle

results.description: Come play Beach Tennis with me! I have a paddle for you too. All we need is to get time on the calendar. Beach Tennis has similar scoring system to regular tennis, 'Love, 15, 30, 40, Game' with no fault nor advantage points, the ball has no bounce in your court before you hit it back to opponent so it's a quicker game then tennis and lots of fun! The court is similar in size to a beach volleyball court, 16m long x 8m wide. There are several volleyball courts in Central Park, including the courts near Sheep Meadow. If you walk toward the east side of the park from Sheep Meadow, you will find two asphalt courts and one sand court. The courts are in the center of the park near 70th Street and adjacent to the Mall. There are also asphalt courts in the center of the park at 86th Street, next to the Great Lawn and the Central Park police precinct. You can find more info, the full rule book and instructional video at the official website of ITF: http://www.itftennis.com/beachtennis/about-beach-tennis/how-to-play

It is a moment in which we openly expose our fears, anger, anxieties asking God to help us. It is a time for thanksgiving for His kindness and mercies. It is a moment to get reenergized. Our emotions, such as anger, fear or frustrations saps energy away. It is so important to seat in Gods presence. 

This group is been formed so that people come to experience the power of prayer and hear others share how prayer helped transform their life's.

Join us.

This is a genuine, small meetup group where new parents and families living in Jersey City Heights, Union City (and nearby areas) , can meet and get to know each other. A few things that make this meetup group extra awesome...

All the cool baby activities happen during the week while we are at work, but we don't want our kids to miss out on all the fun, socializing and bonding time! results.description:
This group is open to anyone looking to make lasting lifestyle changes for a healthier and happier life. I'm based in Livingston, NJ, but anyone in the surrounding area or even from further away is welcome to join.

I'm not a fitness trainer, just a regular guy who reads about the subject and was able to commit myself to a sustainable diet and exercise routine. In just one year, I was able to transform my very overweight body into something much leaner, stronger, and healthier.

It dawned on me that society, as well as the diet and fitness industry, makes healthy living and weight loss seem much harder for people than it really is. With all of the fad diets, expensive supplements, and health myths out there, the average person can hardly be blamed for thinking that healthy living is impossible. It isn't though, and now I want to share my experiences in the hopes of helping others who are looking to make a similar journey.

This group will be easily accessible, with weekend Meetups in cafes and casual eateries where we can all chat in a relaxed setting. There we can share advice on diet, nutrition, sleep, stress management, exercise, or any other health related subject that you may have questions about.

If there's enough interest, I might also expand into group workout sessions at a local park or gym. One step at a time though!

This is an all-inclusive group. It doesn't matter if you're young or old, male or female. Whether you're looking to lose weight, get toned, build strength, look better, or overhaul your health, this group can be the one for you!
results.name: Essex County New Jersey Fitness Group

results.description: This is a group for those who have a love for the paranormal and would like to be a part of a paranormal investigating team. Do you have love the paranormal ? Do you watch countless shows on SYFY, Detestation or Travel channels, or videos on Youtube and say "I wish I was there!" or "I could have done a better job!"? Did the film Ghostbusters inspire your fascination with the paranormal? Do you have a love for film and would like to tackle a new and bold project? There are very few paranormal investigating teams in Brooklyn and I would like to start one. This is also a group for people who enjoy discussing about the paranormal and meeting people who share the same interests. Filmmakers are also welcome (I would also like for us to film our investigations as well) because this is a chance for you to potentially capture something very unique. Whether you are a professional or someone just starting out or a filmmaker looking for a new project to tackle, all are welcome. Ideally we would all meet once a week and plan we will do our investigations and so forth. I would like to go to several haunted locations. The goal of this group is building a team. I would like to not just meet people but hopefully we can all eventually be good friends. I don't care how much experience you have in ghost hunting. I just want to meet people who love the supernatural as much as I do. Hope to see you soon! Happy Haunting!

results.description:
Exhibitionists who don't know how to draw. Artists curious about exploring public nudity. Gay/Straight. All those who seek a free and encouraging environment to explore the human form. You will learn something. You will make a friend. Come with a mind open to new experiences. This is a safe space. 

$20 cash upon arrival or $15 in advance

All Genders

RSVP - space is limited. A ticket does not ensure entry. You must be on time and on the list. 

1) What IS Naked Drink n Draw? 
*** It's an immersive study in figure drawing while under the influence. In short, you get naked, have some drinks, and draw each other. Sound fun? It is! I will generally start off the night as the first model. After that, we take a volunteer from the pool of artists. We'll continue to take turns as models while everyone else draws. The parlor will be set up for drawing, the work room will be set up for painting, and if enough people are in attendance, the bedroom may be made available for additional drawing space. 

2) I can’t draw... 
*** I can't draw either. It's not about that. Nobody's going to laugh at you if you suck. You could be god awful, but you may find you're better than you think. I can guarantee you won’t be the only shitty artist in the room. Besides, the only way to improve is with practice, and what better way to learn?! 

3) Are the drawings judged? 
*** There will be a period at the end to critique each others' work, but nobody has to participate. No obligations to share your work. If you are comfortable with your work being photographed, I would like to post it on the group pages. 

4) How much is it? 
*** It’s $20 at the door, $15 in advance. 

5) Can I model? 
*** You are more than welcome to model. Take turns! Ideally, if we're all naked, we all stand an opportunity as model if we so desire. The only rule I have is you must be nude to pose. That is sort of the point, after all.

6) What do I bring? 
*** Bring supplies and booze. I will provide some art supplies for those without, but I'm afraid I can not supply free booze. But hey, tip generously and I'll think about it ;P 

7) Can I take photos? 
*** Nope. You can draw pictures, but you can’t snap them. Why, you might ask? It's kinda creepy, in a room full of naked strangers, to pull out your camera. Even if you ask, putting one "No" on the spot in a room full of "Yes" is the sort of intimidation and alienation I'm hoping to avoid. Respect this rule, please. Don't be a creep. 

8) Who can come? 
*** Anyone! with some conditions 
-If I do not know you, and we have never spoken, shoot me a message first. Let me know who you are before you enter my home.
-If you want to bring a guest or three, let me know. 
-If you want to come but not get naked, I think you may find one of the other hundreds of NY drawing groups a bit more your speed.

9) Anything else I should know? 
***This is a safe space with supportive people and a free and encouraging energy. While people will be naked, don't just assume that's license to read someone's ass like it's brail. Please be respectful, consensual adults. If you start to creep people out, you leave. Also, please be quiet in the stairwell. My neighbors are real sweet people, you guys. 

10) Where is it? 
***  Ocean ave at Parkside Ave in Brooklyn. Parkside ave Q stop. Three buildings from the subway, on Ocean, across from the park. The address will be sent out the day before the event. 

11) My boyfriend is not comfortable with me coming to this thing. Is this a sex party? 
*** This is my home. Keep sexpectations to a minimum, and know the line between sex and sexy. We also have couples come to every event. If your significant other is jealous, bring them! That said, if anything grows while you pose, don't sweat it. Appreciate it. 

12) How many people will be there? Will it be crowded? 
*** I'm saying maximum capacity is 30. Won't be crowded. 

13) What kind of poses are we doing? 
*** ENTIRELY up to you. You can go anywhere from Venus De Milo modesty to spred out and comfy. We're just naked people sketching naked people. For the first few hours we'll be working with short poses. After that we'll move on to longer poses. You can do couple/group long poses or individual 10 minute poses. 

 
If you have questions feel free to call or text me at 347.409.1220
results.name: Naked Drink N Draw (NDND) - All Genders!

results.description:
Welcome to Into the Wild: Long Beach Family Adventures!

We are a family nature club in Long Beach, NY with a goal to connect children, their families and local communities to nature and to each other. We are members of the Children & Nature Network!

https://youtu.be/dZi0Cxs3fCo


We invite you to family hikes, local park and preserve meet-ups, upstate mountain exploration, sand castle building, bird watching, fishing, back yard gardening, nature crafts, trips to the zoo, and so much more! 

We welcome NY families with kids who are beginner or ''seasoned'' outdoor explorers! 

Our goal is help families bond with their kids in the GREAT OUTDOORS! As parents, grandparents, aunts/uncles we are driven by the desire to bond, teach and grow with our children. Getting into nature with your child and finding the inner explorer within yourself cultivates a beautiful relationship and creates memories that will have a lasting impact. 

About the group: 

Into the Wild: Long Beach Family Adventures is a family nature club founded in May 2016 by Maria Detherage, a local mother of 3 wild things. 

Maria grew up in the country side of Pennsylvania with some of her greatest childhood memories created during her time spent outdoors exploring with her 6 siblings and camping trips led by her courageous dad. As she grew, she fell in love with the outdoors and people from different cultures. Her passion brought her to places she never imagined she would explore...the jungle villages of Belize, the coasts of West Africa, and the deserts of Arizona. It is in Arizona, in a small national park, where she vowed to start a lifetime adventure with her forever-partner Dan. 

Maria and Dan led a life full of wild outdoor adventures...their favorite place to be together was anywhere under the stars. Fast forward nine years and three kids later, Maria and Dan now call Long Beach, NY their home. They found living a more urban lifestyle in NY created new types of adventure; however, living by the beach offered a home with a nature escape close by. While building their careers and family, time spent exploring their wild earth seemed to be a distant memory. 

One day, while driving up an off-ramp of 495 LIE, wild thing #2 yelled, "Woohoo! We are climbing a mountain." As they reached the top of the ramp, wild thing #1 yelled, "We are ON TOP OF THE WORLD!" Maria and Dan looked at each other in disbelief that THEIR beautiful, sweet offspring thought that THIS ramp was a mountain! They realized that in the business of life, they were not sharing some of their deepest passions with their children. It was a turning point for them. 

Maria and Dan made it a point to get outdoors with their kids and seek new wild experiences. Their most recent adventure took them through the ancient redwood forest and along the coast of Northern California. Returning home from their trip they realize that TIME spent outdoors together was uplifting and priceless. They decided to start "Into the Wild" because adventures in nature can be found even in your own backyard. They hope to connect with other families who love nature and desire to give their children more sunshine and less screen time. 

Come join us and get Into the Wild!
results.name: Into the Wild: Long Beach Family Adventures

This Meetup group is not affiliated with any organization. We are an independent group of friends and would be friends who enjoy walking and hiking together. It is designed for people who are fit and in reasonably good shape and who want to get some exercise and learn more about New York City. New York City Hiking Tours is “more walk and less talk. The hikes and walks vary in length from 4-10 miles and can last anywhere from 2-6 hours or so. These events are fairly fast paced although I will stop on occasion a number of times to talk very briefly about what we see. We cover a lot of ground at a reasonably steady pace and the goal is to see as much of a specific area in New York City as possible. It is my hope that on each and every hiking tour you will not only experience something that will give you a sense of wonder and excitement but you will enjoy yourself as well.

I plan on visiting and exploring many different areas in New York City. For example, I really enjoy exploring Central Park (I have guidebooks from the 1860’s), the lower Manhattan Waterfront, Riverside Park, Prospect Park, Williamsburg, Vinegar Hill, DUMBO, Brooklyn Bridge Park, Chelsea and the Meat Packing District where I am familiar with a number of art galleries there, Roosevelt Island, Governors Island, Long Island City etc. etc. I tend to focus on certain areas and know some of these areas better than others. 

 I make it a point to insure that the hikes and walks I lead are a lot of fun. BUT and this is a big BUT, I take the RSVP process very seriously and expect that any participant should do the same. I will often limit registration to keep the group size manageable and I do not like to keep a “Wait List” for a lengthy period of time. I want you to be able to plan your day in advance and I want to be able to plan the event as well. If you RSVP for an event and are a “No Show” and you do not have a good reason for not showing up, I am going to simply delete you from the group. If you make it a habit of withdrawing your RSVP shortly before an event begins, I am also going to delete you from the group. Meeting Details will only be provided to those who RSVP and will not be publicized on the website. I’m just asking that people be considerate to me and the others in the Group and that every one act responsibly. 

Any activity that I lead for New York City Hiking Tours will be FREE. However, as an Organizer I have to pay Meetup so you are always welcome to give a donation of one or two dollars or whatever you want at the beginning or end of an event.
results.name: New York City Hiking Tours

results.description:
There are lots of apps and online literature out there about personal finance. But sometimes you just don't know where to look, what information to trust or even what some of that information means. In most cases it's much better to be in a nice small group of your peers being educated about personal finance and having your questions answered by a financial advisor right there in person. 

So if you're looking for a group that can break down the complex vocabulary, explain the various investing options on ANY budget and also provide strategies to help you save, budget, pay off student loan or credit card debt....then you've found the right place!

Join Yope! We have workshops all over Manhattan that do just that. Meet up in small groups with a Financial Advisor for about 90 minutes and go over a lesson plan focusing on budgeting, spending, saving and investing. 

Yope also has topic specific workshops that revolve solely on a certain subject matter (for example starting your own business or getting a grasp on credit) So welcome and let the age of financial understanding begin now!
results.name: Yope Financial Literacy Workshops

results.description:
Hola a todos/as : I am David, a former Fulbright grantee from Spain with a B.A. in Humanities and 2 Master's, always willing to spread my beloved Spanish Language. Regardless of your level ( beginner, intermediate, advance) you'll improve your language skills. Let me know what you think you need.

Beginner level means you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expressions. 

Intermediate level means you may explain yourself without the help of the teacher but when you build up sentences, they are very basic or you make mistakes on them. You lack  vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a problem and you know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make grammatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is ok.
results.name: New York Spanish Language Conversation/Private Lessons

results.description: The Made In New York Jazz Gala became one of the most significant International jazz events in New York, featuring legendary Jazz Artists. Our prior Gala Concerts included multi Grammy Award winners Randy Brecker and Lenny White. Special guest lineup included Alex Blake, Bobby Sanabria and winner and participants of the competition www.madeinnyjazz.com, from more than 10 Countries. This year we celebrate our 3rd Annual, International Jazz Gala. The winner of the competition João Barradas, one of the most recognized young accordionists in Europe, will be performing this year. “I regard João Barradas as a beacon in the future development of accordion as a serious instrument. He is a master of all styles from classical repertoire and is the most convincing jazz improviser I have heard to date on the instrument.” – Gil Goldstein “One of the most diligent and reliable young musicians that I have encountered” – Greg Osby “Beyond Impressive” – Nicholas Payton “Didn’t think it’d be possible on accordion! Check out João Barradas” – Walter Smith III “Magnificent” – Jazz.pt “A musician extraordinaire, technically gifted with an immensely creative and sophisticated phrasing.” – Nelson Cascais João Barradas and other participants TBA of Made In New York Jazz Competition will be joined by stellar lineup of American jazz masters: Rufus Reid, one of today’s premiere bassists on the international jazz scene, with his reputation firmly established in the education arena. Tommy Campbell (known for his work with Dizzy Gillespie, Sonny Rollins and others), Philip Harper (The Jazz Messengers and Charles Mingus Big Band), Bobby Sanabria 7 times Grammy award nominee, composer, arranger, educator and writer specializing in Latin jazz. Yaacov Mayman, art director of the competition (Yaacov has performed and/or recorded with Joe Lovano, Benny Golson, Ray Santiago and others). The host of the GALA 2016 will be George V Johnson Jr., one of the most recognizable jazz voices who mentored and performed regularly with “James Moody & Lou Donaldson”. Special guest from Italy: Federico Malayalam from Italy! Internet sensation and one of the most watched jazz, fusion bass players on YouTube and social media. Some of his videos performing have well over a million views, displaying great musicianship and a technical ability that is jaw dropping. The Made in New York Jazz Competition enters its fourth year in 2016, featuring a worldwide audience of jazz fans, as well as a slate of musicians from 47 countries and counting. “The talents keep surprising us every year! It’s great to be part of this discovery process. Our community grows very fast, just last year the competition was ranked as number one jazz competition in Google, Yahoo and Bing. This is an incredible feeling to see some of the artists succeed after participating in Made In New York Jazz Competition” – says Misha Brovkin, founder of the competition.
results.name: Jazz Gala at Tribeca

results.description:
We are New Yorkers of all ages and physical ability levels looking to get out of the city for a weekend (or longer) on our bikes. Bike touring is a wonderful way to travel and see the world. But you don't always have to go very far, or go away for a long time to experience it. In fact, there are many places close by to the New York Metro Region that are perfect for 1- or 2-night bike trips where you either camp or stay in a hotel. You can also do many longer distance one-day rides with friends that can take you to a local winery or microbrewery where you can enjoy the effort it took to get there with a drink and a nice meal.

This meet up group is sponsored by Gotham Bicycle Tours, which is a local bike touring company that organizes 1- and 2-night bike tours along with wine and beer-tasting day rides for people looking to escape the city. While many of the listings are tours you can take with Gotham Bicycle Tours, this meet-up group is also intended to be a forum for individuals to meet other people to do their own bicycle adventures. Perhaps you have a lot of camping experience and you aren't an avid cyclist? Or perhaps you've done lots of cycling, but need help coming up with an overnight tour idea. Either way, we hope to connect you with the right resources on this MeetUp group!

results.description:
This is a group for women to come together, who are either currently experiencing peri- and/or menopausal symptoms, or who anticipate going through peri-/menopause in the near-term.   Those who've already completed the menopause process are also more than welcome to join us and share their insights/experiences.  This group will provide an opportunity for us to share knowledge, ask questions of others, and otherwise provide support to each other.

I anticipate that overall membership in this group will be transitory...that is, members will likely come and go based upon their own personal needs.  As such, I will rotate through and periodically repeat a standard set of discussion topics so that various members can pick and choose the meetings or topics they are most interested in.  By rotating through a set of standard topics, this will also ensure that newer members all get a chance to join in each of the key conversations.

In between, I will also arrange various social mixers, where there will be no formal 'agenda', but simply a chance for all of us to celebrate ourselves and each other during this transitory period of our lives.

Please Note:

Each Menopal will have different ideas or approaches on how to manage her own symptoms, so no one should ever discount another member's way of dealing with peri-/menopause symptoms.  Rather, we will talk about what does/does not work for each of us personally. 

I will host events at public venues (focusing on Manhattan for the most part, or else Astoria...since that's where I live) that can allow for conversation while at the same time, afford us a bit of privacy.   I may even host meetings at my home now and then; other Menopals can also offer up their home for any given meeting date as well, if they'd like. 

For our more formal discussion-based meetings, each will focus around a certain discussion topic, i.e.,

• What is Peri-Menopause vs Menopause?  What are Various Aspects of Both?  Specific Physical and Mental Symptoms and Ways of Managing Them

• Has This Process Changed Your View of Self/the Aging Process/Death?

• Effects on Romantic Relationships/Sexuality/What Do You Do to Continue to Feel Vibrant & Attractive?

• Positive Outcomes from Menopause/How Has It Changed You for the Better?  (this will be more geared to women who are closer to, or have completed, menopause)

I'll rotate between and repeat these general discussion topics so that folks can choose which topics interest them most, and which are convenient to their own schedules.

I will ask for a $2 donation from all members at each meeting to help cover Organizer fees that I must pay to Meetup.  Thank you!
results.name: New York Women's Menopause Support Meetup

results.description:
DISCUSSIONS 

A good portion of this meetup's activities are the discussion meetups. In these events the community of the group can meetup and talk and discuss general topics in a laid back and comfortable environment! Topics usually fall under personal growth, psychology, philosophy, communication, and much more! Seldom we will change locations to dining out or if the weather permits us outside somewhere! * These meetups are totally free and I encourage everyone to attend! The more the better!

___________________________________________________________________________________________________

WORKSHOPS 

Not only am I dedicated by my passion to evolve our limitations and challenges, but we get to do it together! My workshops are interpersonal, pragmatic, and energetic. There is the touch of vulnerability with a side of edge and ambiguity. These workshops are ideal for business and personal groups. *Workshops are paid events.

_________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 

PUBLIC SPEAKING 

This is where the real magic is. Speaking is more then something you listen to. Speaking should be felt on a deeper level, and thought of in a transforming and insightful way. My purpose in speaking is to transform the room so that the observer will be intrigued, empowered and hungry for life, and my speech unforgotten. *Public Speaking are paid events.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 

LIFE COACHING

If I could have this service mean one thing to you, it would be the tool in which you find your success. Life coaching isn’t just about getting you to where you want to be, it’s also about establishing a relationship with yourself and the world. Creating that harmony results in your success, your empowerment, and the complete control over your life, what you do and how you feel. *This is usually a paid, private event from 1-6 people.


You may want to join the group, or attend a meetup if: 

• Your interested in attending Workshops, speaking events, and seminars

• You are seeking answers about spirituality and personal development 

• You like to talk about philosophy and spiritual ideas 

• Feel like you've plateaued, your looking to stay purposeful   

• Diversifying your time with something proactive and engaging

• You are interested in being a life coach, or being coached

• You are a manager or upper management absorbing different perspectives.

• You are seeking counseling or Life Coaching 

• witching career (Ergo different purpose)

• Seeking relationship or communication resources 

• You want to know more information about the workshop 

• You want to have a healthier lifestyle 

• Make friends and long lasting friendships 

•  Learn skills you never thought you had!

• You want to discover your purpose or passion!

• Awaken the power dormant within you

• Motivate and s others!


Contact Daniel for more information: DanielMotivating@DanielSpeiss.org | 631.745.8686
