results.description: New Brunswick’s Reiki Community is safe, open place for Reiki practitioners of all lineages and people new to Reiki to come together and experience the loving energy of Reiki. Reiki (pronounced ray-key) is a form of energy healing that is deeply relaxing and promotes the healing of the mind,body, and spirit. The best way to understand Reiki is to breakdown the Japanese kanji: Rei mean Spiritual Wisdom and Ki means Life Energy. So, Reiki means Spiritually Guided Life Energy. Ki is found is all different languages and cultures; in Sanskrit, it is prana, in Chineses it is Chi, and by scientists it is bioenergy field. Reiki is a very special type of Ki that always knows what is good for your best and highest healing because Reiki practitioners do not direct Ki but hold space for Divine Wisdom to guide the Ki. Reiki is done by either light touch or no-touch techniques with the goal of increasing our flow of Ki which causes us to feel better. The best way to truly understand Reiki is to come and try it!
results.name: New Brunswick's Reiki Community

results.description:
I’m Amarilis Reynoso and I am the creator of The Art of Living Project. A way of life and a set of guiding principles and practical tools for everyday living to transform key areas of your life. A framework for deep self-exploration for each of us to craft our very own extraordinary life.

If you’re like me, you experienced that by the time we reach our 40s, 50s, and 60s most women seem to be getting a very strong urge to live a more authentic life – one more in alignment with their heart’s desires. You know the saying: You become like the average of the five people you spend most of your time with. You also become like the people who challenge and support you. This community is committed to success — to supporting and challenging one another.  I’m on this grand adventure, growing and expanding to live an epic life and nothing less. I’m pushing myself and journeying beyond the confines of daily life into terrains of wonder, kindness, acceptance, revelation, delight and transformation to do some pretty awesome things. I want to help inspire and motivate other women to do the same in their life.  My greatest gift to you would be to collapse your timeline so you don’t spend another year, five years or another decade trying to figure this all out on your own and without the support and accountability that are crucial elements of success. My mission is to change the conversation around middle aged women. This is a new life phase, a tremendous opportunity for reinvention. 

Whatever it is you are looking to do: write a book, start a business, get healthy and fit once and for all, find a life partner, or just explore and create, surrounding yourself with a community that is willing and able to help you is priceless. My role is to be organizer, strategist, facilitator and connector of human potential. This meetup is based out of Paramus, NJ (my current hometown). Monthly meetups will take place at various locations in Rockland and Bergen counties and maybe NYC.

A few rules:

• Please use a facial photo in your profile. We need to be able to recognize you for meet-ups. 

• Please be considerate to the hosts when you RSVP.  If something comes up, please change your RSVP.  No-shows are inconsiderate. After 3 no-shows, you will be removed from the group. 

• Inactive members are removed from the group after 3 months of no activity. 

• We ask that attendees please not use our events to promote their business/products, services. There are many other networking groups specifically designed for marketing your business.  I thank you in advance for respecting this request. 

https://www.facebook.com/thebesthalf/
results.name: The Art of Living Project

results.description:
A place to cook. And learn. And vibe.

About The Chef
Anthony Brown, son of Caribbean chefs is a native New Yorker with an ever-evolving passion for cooking, healthy food, physical fitness and spiritual awareness. In the comfort of his condo apartment, Anthony offers recreational cooking classes within an open, elaborate kitchen space. New Taste, Each Class
During these “hands-on” cooking class students learn easy, innovative cooking techniques in a team building manner. Additionally, each class incorporates various raw spices and seasoning used to flavor various dishes from every corner of the culinary world – American, Caribbean, Italian, Thai and more. Most classes conclude with generous portions. Anthony would not want you to walk away hungry!

Classes are suitable for all levels of cooking expertise and make a great team building activity or way to spend quality time with a friend. 

Cost: $50/Person. Covers all food ingredients, eating utensils, and recipe notes provided. Up to 4 students per class. 2 Hours.


E: abrown12@gmail.com

results.description:
This group is for tesla car owners and electric vehicle enthusiasts in NYC and surrounding areas.  The group includes tesla motors fans, smart car geeks and clean energy fans. I started this group because I wanted to meet other tesla car enthusiasts.  Fun get togethers and electric car information sharing is planned.

We are just 11 members so far - and growing daily!  I hope to organize a get together soon, most likely in June.   Events could include:

- a meet up at a pub/restuarant in Brooklyn or Manhattan to swap EV (electric vehicle) and smart car stories and tech questions

- attend (with group members) an EV or Green/Clean Energy event in the NYC area

- organize a road trip using EV's to a fun destination

- act as organizers or volunteers for a clean energy initiative of our choosing

- any and all meetup ideas will be considered

Note: I wish to include Hybrid cars too, when I say EV

More updates to follow soon. 

Pat

p.s. National and local EV incentive information (Federal EV tax break, NYS EV rebate, Long Island HOV lane pass and the EZPass green discount) are also on file with this group - for interested members.
results.name: Tesla Club Brooklyn NYC

results.description:
FITNESS POSSE (FitP)™
Maybe you made a New Year’s Resolution to slim down but still have not succeeded with any exercise regimen or diet. Maybe you have decided to stay away from fast foods and could benefit from a guardian angel or two or three looking over your shoulder. Or perhaps you have not been putting in time for that recommended cardio workout to keep your blood pressure in check. Now you have a whole group of people to prop you up and get you going, sometimes with kind words, at other times with firm reminders or an effective strategy. What works for them may work for you and vice versa.

 
FITNESS POSSE was conceived after soul searching for a way that people who lead complicated lives can honor a commitment to improving their physical and nutritional routines. FITNESS POSSE is a mutual admiration membership which offers ongoing support to members as they go about their daily lives. While scheduled Fitness Posse meet-ups center around celebrating achievements and having fun, members are expected to maintain contact outside of meet-ups using whatever means of remote communication is convenient for them: It is this level of communication that distinguishes FITNESS POSSE.

FITNESS POSSE is NOT:

x The Biggest Loser. Members will come with their own personal fitness goals, which may not necessarily be intense but appropriate for them. The role of other POSSE members is to encourage a member to reach those goals.

x A match-making service. Members relate to each other first and foremost as human beings and appreciate that FITNESS POSSE is comprised of individuals of all ages and physical attributes.

x A professional training service. No trainers here, just people committed to improving their stamina, body image and well-being.

x A potential client pool for sales pitching or market research. Membership should have expectation of reasonable respect for their privacy and confidentiality from others that they entrust with their contact information.
results.name: New York FITNESS POSSE (FITP)

results.description:
There is a lot of truth to the visionary words of John Dickinson: 

"United we stand. Divided we fall." 

What are companies – big and small – but unity with a business purpose. 

However, not all of us are wired for that version of work-life tradition; that amount of structure; that type of commitment. Instead, we are more independent. We, as they say, march to a different beat. We are not less able to contribute, just different in how we choose to do so.   

On the other hand, unity, in the traditional business sense, does have its privileges: 

• Comradery & Socializing

• Interaction & Serendipity

• Consistency & Boundaries

• Networking & Empathy

• Growth & Opportunity 

We, as 1099'ers, deserve these perks as well. And who better than us to create them? 

That is why Cafe 1099 was born.

We are a group committed to championing the unique needs of current and future 1099'ers. 

Our motto / tagline: #Knowledge & #Events for the #1099Lifestyle.

Let's join together for:

 - Topical Presentations – For professional development and personal growth.

 - Open round tables – To share and discuss pain points, best practices, and success stories.

 - Other Meetups – There are plenty of other great Meetups we can take advantage of.

 - Online – There is a LinkedIn group (https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7053902), and Café 1099 can be found on all the major social networks.

 - Happy Hour –Simple and effective. Sometimes downtime yields the best brainstorming.

 In short, the potential is nearly infinite. The goal is to bring 1099'ers together, organize (a bit), and see where we can go and what we can do. Together.


p.s. Visit http://Cafe1099.com/MU to join the mailing list, as well as links to our other social profiles.
results.name: Cafe 1099

results.description:
Learn to focus your mind for beneficial changes in mental, emotional and physical well being. Research has shown hypnosis and self hypnosis practice over time are safe and effective ways to help the brain create new neurological pathways, resulting in new patterns of thought and behavior. Scientific studies have validated the theory that the we are can change the structure of the brain with new experiences. Our unwanted habits and behaviors are habituated patterns in the brain that can be changed by creating new neural connections.
The hypnosis process can allow neuroplasticity to occur where formation of new neural pathways and rewriting of old pathways. This type of deep rooted change that occurs in hypnosis creates transformative and lasting change as the brain is learning to reprogram itself to adapt new and beneficial patterns while neutralizing unwanted habits and behaviors. These changes have been shown to be stimulated in response to suggestion and reinforcement that is prominent in hypnosis.
Hypnosis provides the means of accessing your resources to maintain sustainable behavior change to transform your goals into action.
results.name: Integrative Health and Hypnosis

results.description:

There will be opportunities for people to share their current and past experiences about where they have lived as a way of building community and increasing members knowledge of different parts of New York City.   We will aim to have interesting discussions about what we each value in a community which may lead  us to explore new neighborhoods.

Each guided neighborhood experience will last from 2-3 hours and may include brief stops at local businesses, cafes, green space, and other points of interest to get a more intimate flavor of the neighborhood. Members may make requests and suggestions for future meetups, and we can venture into more obscure sections of the city.

The group leader, Hank Orenstein, is a licensed NYC Tour Guide, urban historian, visual artist, retired social worker - and also a real estate broker with The Corcoran Group.  The leader will impart his knowledge of the real estate market to provide practical information for members who wish to gain more knowledge of current and future housing stock in each neighborhood.

This group offers a variety of activities and events including (but not limited) to the following: dining out, sporting events, movies, bus trips, and more.

Please be aware most events, activities and dining out meetups will be in $50 to $150 per person range.  Additionally, trips offered by this group will be in the $3000 to $6000 per person range - all travel and trips are handled directly by a professional travel agent.

• Dining out

• Sporting Events

• Hikes and Picnics

results.description:
Our loved ones in spirit are never more than a thought away. They're always close, willing and able to help you. Have you noticed recurring images that remind you of them, or heard a song just as you were thinking about them, or noticed initials or numbers associated with them popping up coincidentally? Have the electrics acted up or your ears been buzzing? Have you asked a question and suddenly an answer or idea comes out of nowhere? Perhaps you’ve had vivid dreams of them? These are some of the ways our loved ones in Spirit maintain continuing bonds with us on this side of the veil. 

 If you are grieving the loss of a loved one or are having a hard time and would like validation of their support and continued presence, this group takes a very twenty-first century approach to bereavement and learning how to continue relationships through the veil in a healthy way. It will show you how to live in a healthy and loving way during the grieving process and this temporary separation. We will do guided meditations to be able to sense the presence of your loved one and know that love never dies. 

This is not a mediumship development group and does not require mediumistic ability; it is for anyone who is grieving and wants the reassurance that there is no separation and that the human spirit survives the transition we call death.
results.name: NYC Healing Grief with Mediumship

results.description:
Fearless Women, Queen of Media & Diana' Real talk

presents our 2nd

Women's Empowerment Luncheon!!
"To help create a positive, healthy mind, To motivate & empower in order to accomplish your goals & reach your highest potential"

Date: Saturday June 26, 2016 3pm-9pm
Location: TBA

We will be honoring Women for Women's History Month and Women in the Military.

The Women Empowerment Luncheon collaboration began in January 2016. Our movement is composed of a network of Women who are either looking for inspiration, motivation, strength, empowerment & sisterhood, women who are launching their businesses for the first time and need resources and tools to make for a successful business and also women who have had successful business and have become entrepreneurial power houses. 

Our mission is threefold: to provide a comfort zone where Women and Children can come to when going through hard times in life in order to get some assistance, protection, uplifting, and positivity; to provide a network where first time business owners can come to gain useful information and guideance in moving forward in launching their business and to provide a platform, through Realistic Linx Magazine and other media outlets, to market their already established business or their brand new business. 

This Quarterly event is comprised of 3 power house teams Fearless Women, Queen of Hearts Media, and Diana Bellamy's Real Talk.

Fearless Women was founded by Sue Fearless. Fearless Women is an organization who through Philanthropy, Volunteering in our community, Empowerment, Motivational Speaking, Private Event Planning, & Workshops, we are able to give back, bring awareness and help our community of Women who are going through challenges, whether it be Women in Military, abuse or a disability and children who are in foster homes and homeless, to name a few.


Queen of Hearts Media is a full service Marketing, Public Relations and Media firm that caters to an elite Celebrity & Corporate Clientele. We offer a wide range of services from planning and executing creative and exciting Marketing Campaigns, planning both large and intimate events and concerts, media campaigns and blog blasts with some of the top media outlets that will generate huge exposure for our clients, and booking celebrities and reality stars to host club appearances and events. 

Diana Bellamy is a mind set coach and a motivational speaker on Women Empowerment Issues and Leadership through NY, NJ an dAtlanta. Diana's Real talk will be based on the busy lives of Women Entrepereneurs and how they go through and make it through challenges in life. 


Event Details:

Our event will include 4 panel speakers who will be touching on topics pertaining to their personal and business back ground.

Panelists include: TBA

Guests will have a chance to hear from Industry professionals and will be able to interact, ask questions and learn some key points they can use in their life journey. 

FOR SPONSORSHIP DETAILS & TO ATTEND

results.description:
NEW MEETUP GROUP




WELCOME TRAIL RUNNERS!


What 
The Blockhouse Run Club (BRC) meets on Tuesdays at 7 am and Saturdays at 9 am. We do a fun and easy run on the bridle path, grass and rocks of Central Park.  Join us to explore its natural beauty, and sometimes visit historic and lesser-known features along the way. Central Park is the base, but occasionally we venture out onto other trails of New York. 

Who 
BRC was started a couple of years ago by two friends for the love of trail running. Trail runners, old and young, and from all over the world have run with BRC. We are a small group (capacity 50 members), and invite others who share that same passion for the trails to run with us on a weekly/regular basis. Experienced trail runners as well as runners training for their first trail races are welcome. Please be comfortable running or brisk run-walking at least six miles on trail. 

Interested? Join us. *

See you on the trails!  



*  If you are a temporary visitor, tourist or prefer not to sign up for this private site: 
You can still try out meets! For more info, visit the BRC public Facebook page.

Photo:  Blockhouse Run Club


Photos:  via Central Park Conservancy




This group's event details and membership are available only to members for privacy and safety. Powered by: BRC volunteers. Copyright Blockhouse Run Club, for all BRC content. Updated:  May 17, 2016.
results.name: Blockhouse Run Club, New York City

topics.name: Group Support for Divorce or Separated Women

results.description:
This group is designed for women who are either thinking about divorce, separated, in the midst of a divorce, or divorced. It's a safe have to voice your worries, fears, and sadness while receiving support and guidance from a certified life coach as well as others members.

Transitions are hard, especially when it comes to divorce. Divorce is an emotional plight, whether amicable or not. You need to get organized and be aware of what you want and need from the divorce proceedings all while dealing with the emotional toll it takes on you and your family. Your entire life gets reshuffled, leaving you feeling overwhelmed and uncertain. You, your family, your finances, and your ego can all be impacted. Change makes you question yourself, your decisions and your aspirations. Life Transitions can leave you feeling:
- Confused and unsettled
- Suffering from low self esteem and confidence
- Overwhelmed and unable to cope
- Fearing how to parent solo
- Unsure of how to date
- Ready to make changes and move on with your life

You may feel like you are in a fog, but you must remember that it is a transitional not a permanent state. With the proper practical and emotional support you can get to the other side, redesign yourself, and enjoy a rich, happy life.

Please note this is not a networking group or a forum to solicit its members. This is a private group. Solicitation of group members is prohibited.
results.name: Divorce Support and Coaching Group for Women

topics.name: Divorced Support For Men and Fathers

results.description:
This group is designed for men who are either thinking about divorce, separated, in the midst of a divorce, or divorced. It's a safe have to voice your anger, worries, fears, and grief while receiving support and guidance from a certified life coach as well as others members.

Transitions are hard, especially when it comes to divorce. Divorce is an emotional plight, whether amicable or not. You need to get organized and be aware of what you want and need from the divorce proceedings all while dealing with the emotional toll it takes on you and your family. Your entire life gets reshuffled, leaving you feeling overwhelmed and uncertain. You, your family, your finances, and your ego can all be impacted. Change makes you question yourself, your decisions and your aspirations. 

Life Transitions can leave you feeling:
- Confused and unsettled
- Suffering from low self esteem and confidence
- Overwhelmed and unable to cope
- Fearing how to parent solo
- Unsure of how to date
- Ready to make changes and move on with your life

You may feel like you are in a fog, but you must remember that it is a transitional not a permanent state. With the proper practical and emotional support you can get to the other side, redesign yourself, and enjoy a rich, happy life.

Please note this is not a networking group or a forum to solicit its members. This is a private group. Solicitation of group members is prohibited.
results.name: Divorce Support and Coaching Group for Men

results.description:
Freedom Rivera empowerment circle offers workshops that focus on helping people become organize, empowered, and inspired to create a plan for a balance and fulfilling life. Topics include: creating your monthly plan, relationships, confidence booster, and more. 

If you have been looking to get out of your shell and would like to start working on those goals which you have been postponing for sometime, wait no longer my friend. This is the group for you. Her workshops are interactive, experiential, strategic and spiritual. 

Freedom applies the techniques of self compassion, mindfulness, positive psychology and her own experiences into her workshops.  Her passion is to help people become aligned with their highest self. 

As a mindset coach, speaker, and thought expert, she has been helping hundreds of people over 7 years as a psychotherapist and presently as a life coach.  She utilizes her skills to help people obtain clarity about their goals and life purpose, stick to their plan and learn to manifest their goals.   She is all about perseverance, and helping her fellow human beings become more courageous, more assertive and aware of their greatness.    

Part of the workshops include circling, which provides the space to share our blessings and challenges of our life journey.  This activity, helps us learn we are not that different from each other and that we hold massive greatness inside each one of us.

A note from Freedom:

"I look forward to meeting you.  Lets create the inspiration and plan for the life that is waiting for you. All you have to do is to take the first step into your life purpose."

With much love,

Freedom.
results.name: Freedom Rivera Empowerment Circle

results.description:
Interested in spirituality? Like to think about theology? Have more questions than answers? Looking for community or conversation? Enjoy beer? Wine? Good food? Join our conversation! Meeting for drinks and food, together we will wrestle with ideas around theology, spirituality, justice, peace, hope, life, death, politics, faith, mercy, love, and more. We hope to learn from one another, to grow in relationship with God, and to figure out ways we can work for justice and wholeness in our community and in the world. 

While this meetup is sponsored by the Presbyterian Church (USA), those of us organizing the meetup recognize that we have more questions than answers about religion and spirituality. We are messy and imperfect and yet we believe the mess is what makes us beautiful and interesting.  We aren't looking for answers but for those who will accompany us on this journey of learning and life. 

You are invited to join our conversation.  Whether you are still connected to a particular religious tradition, have walked away from religion altogether, are spiritual but not religious, are questioning, or simply want an imperfect community of people who will challenge you to be open to God, you are invited.

results.description:
Do you have trouble doing what you KNOW you need to do to solve your problems?
Do you you need that motivation to help you see where your path or your next step/move?
Do you want different perspectives/solutions/support to help solve your problems?

Join this meetup!

Here is the way it works:
1. Everyone brings a topic/issue for conversation (will be randomly chosen)
2. Group discussion takes place.
3. Wrap up and onto the next issue This meetup is for people who want to get down to work so that they can make big and small changes in their lives for the better. The kind of person this will work best for has the the follow qualities and more:

OPEN to change and new ideas/ways of doing things (I'm not familiar with this so let hear it out and give it a try)
WILLING to be accountable and responsible (I'm going to do something because I said I will do it)
WILLING to share ideas, creativity and brainstorming (I've had this experience, I read something that might help...)
WILLING to motivate and challenge, not condemn (You can do this, You said that you were going to do this, so what happened...)
WELCOME honest feedback (Thank you for your feedback...and)
COMMITTED to investing in yourself (I know I have a busy day/week, but I need to find the time for myself to do this) Looking forward to meeting you!
Kim

results.description:
Loving Greetings!

This group is for everyone who are interested in wellness, personal development and self-realization through Yoga.

I practice yoga more than 10 years. Mental and physical changes I experienced during my education let me to research Yoga and its philosophy in more depth, with continued practice in a conscious manner, I experienced even more positive results of Yoga in my life.

As I witnessed the effects of Yoga on my health, I have attained a healthy body, a peaceful and happy mind, my passion for Yoga further increased from just a hobby to a passion, a way of life.

Based on the idea of; if ''I” can do it, I wanted to share my experiences and what I have learned. I realized, my biggest goal in life is to serve humanity with the desire to ensure a healthy life, inner peace, happiness and love by the application of Yoga through more ''consciousness” and ''awareness”.

As a Karma Yoga Project I started to offer Donation based yoga classes last summer at the North Hudson Park to reach more people and share the knowledge of Yoga.

And I'm excited to announce that this season we have more classes for all levels!

Please check the class schedule, choose the best class for you, come and join us!

Enjoy the practice of Yoga surrounded by nature with a beautiful lake view.

Improve your strength and flexibility, while getting energized and refreshed!

Everybody is more than welcome to join us! If you haven't practiced Dharma Yoga yet, I'm sure you will love it!

You can also join us on Facebook and get the schedule for other classes in North Bergen!

link: https://www.facebook.com/Hatha-Raja-Yoga-with-Burcu-Gokcek-351314568364431/?ref=bookmarks

Can't wait to meet and practice together! 😍 <br>

Lot's of love from my heart to yours.

Offering with love! 💖😇

Namaste,

Burcu Gokcek

www.burcu-gokcek.com

<br>

"Karma Yoga is the yoga of selfless-service and skillful action. By selfless action, one can attain knowledge of the Self. Do selfless work, and don't even think of the spiritual benefits." ~ Sri Dharma Mittra

This space is meant to provide lesbian, bisexual, and queer identified women with a healthy environment, free of judgement, and one that promotes inclusiveness and the freedom to be You! Let's obliterate shyness together in safe spaces and engage in common activities and outings. Our meetups are tailored to provide you with a relaxed and diverse atmosphere at local restaurants and lounges, among other venues, where you can mix and mingle with other NYC & NJ lesbians, including me, Melissa, your Organizer! All you have to do is fill out a free profile and RSVP to our next event! Easy right?!

My meetup will also welcome members to create their own suggested events, like park outings, museum visits, movie nights, etc. You too can contribute to the types of gatherings you'd like to have. 

*If you identify as a Woman, or identify as Queer, instead of the label Lesbian, you are welcomed here too*

Love and Happiness,

Melissa

I also produce other events that may not be announced here on our group. Please Friend Request me or join my NYC Lesbian Events Group on Facebook where I announce ALL of my events as well as those that my friends are producing and  hosting. https://www.facebook.com/melissamendez76 and https://www.facebook.com/groups/60354281640...

results.description:
Hey everyone! I did a search through the groups on here and noticed that there is no group specifically for Theatre Geeks here in NYC. Given that NYC is one of if not THE biggest performing arts mecca of the world, there should be one. "Hamilton" is out and the hottest (and hardest) ticket to get right now. It is our time...

**This group is for those 18 and older.**

A few goals with this group:

1.Talk about kinks and share kinky/sexy stories!

2. Talk about kink and non-kink theatre events, ideas, issues, and happenings.

While we all have interested outside of theatre, as this is a theatre group for kinky PoCs, please keep all discussions generally based on or around those two topics.

My goals:

My goal would be to get us all together by planning munches, group outings to shows, and (if the vibe is right) play parties! Such gatherings would be in primarily in and geared to folks in NYC. However, we welcome any and all PoCs from other places who want to hang and party with us!

I should also reiterate that this group is strictly for PoCs. This means that you must be a Person of Color to join us. If you are not a Person of Color, I would respectfully ask that you seek another theater group and respect our space.

This group is PoC and queer friendly. Do not be afraid to join us if you queer, trans, agender, anything in between or all of the above.

bowne park civic association meets publicly every quarter

Scheduled speakers such as:

results.description:
The Harley Davidson Breakout Friends is a group of Harley Davidson enthusiasts who ride Harley's Softail Breakout FXSB since being introduced in 2013.  The Harley Davidson Breakout Friends group was originally founded through Facebook in March 2014.  Since then over 3500 world-wide members from as far away as London, Switzerland, Germany, Russia, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and India, have joined the group.  The group has since moved from Facebook to an official website.  https://breakout-friends.org/index.php/en/

This meetup group is an expansion of the one formed in Europe and will focus on meeting other Breakout owners from New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut.  We hope to organize plenty of group rides and meetup events as well as participate in some of the fund raisers and charity runs throughout the year.  

On that note, if you hear of any cool events coming up please feel free to share with us and/or post the info on this site.  You can also contact me directly.  

As a side note, please keep in mind that we are NOT a motorcycle club.  We are Breakout enthusiasts who a looking to meet and ride with other Breakout riders.  It's all about congregation and collaboration. Membership is FREE and open to anyone who rides a Harley Davidson Softail Breakout FXSB.  

Meetup locations may vary depending on the destination for that day, but we usually like to meet up at the Cycle Gear parking lot in White Plains, NY, which is close to i87, i287, Sprain Pkwy, and Bronx Parkway.   

Finally, please feel free to visit the Harley Davidson Breakout Friends official merchandise shop if you need a back patch, T-shirt or hoodie.  They have some pretty cool stuff and there are no requirements.  Delivery usually takes approx. 2-3 weeks.  

https://breakout-friends.org/index.php/en/shop-link

Looking forward to seeing you soon!  Now, let's see those patches!

Ride safe!  

DRod
results.name: Harley Davidson Breakout Friends NY/NJ/CT

results.description:
You: 

You built a wonderful machine of a business that delights your customers and provides your employees with challenging and interesting work. Now you've been considering an exit, but you're unsure how to get started. 

OR

You're building a wonderful machine of a business to delight your customers and provide your employees with challenging and interesting work. You want to prepare yourself for an exit, but you're unsure of how your business should be designed to ensure a good sales price. 


Now there is a Meetup group where you can meet the professionals who buy and sell businesses: http://www.meetup.com/How-to-Sell-Your-Busi...


This group is designed to help business owners better understand business succession and meet potential buyers and of course facilitate some deals and earn money. 


The goal here is to focus not only on business education but also on the actual sale. 


There is no selling of any seminars or programs on how to sell a business at any of the meetups, but you may meet someone qualified to help you with you with your business sale [Lawyers, CPAs, Brokers, Consultants]. Most importantly, if your business is interesting, someone will be prepared to purchase it.

Give me a call to find us at the Meetup or just to get some more information about business succession - 404.987.0830.

• Any given scene is given back-to-back readings by various actors, with all actors having equal opportunity to do any given scene.  (Detailed character breakdowns will have accompanied everyone's invitation to the event.)

Basically, we hold a no-nonsense "work session" with an unconventional format that's sure to be very productive and engaging for all in attendance.

results.description:
This Meetup is for those who make things and make things happen. You spend too much time on your computer. You spend too much time in the office. You should work out but you don't make the time and your life looks and feels the same every day. You need a change in perspective.

One year ago, my wife and I went for a walk. I was too busy and didn't want to go. I had too much work to do and I was inactive and flabby. She encouraged me to try it anyway so I did. It lasted 5.34 miles. At the end, I was exhausted physically, but mentally stimulated beyond belief! It was the best thing I could have done and so I kept going. By the end of that first month, I walked 47.1 miles--mostly on my own.

As an entrepreneur, these walks have helped me grow as a person and a professional. I have a unique perspective that balances my tech-heavy work with the outdoors and nature. I think more clearly and apply my clarity to better focus at work. While I don't take daily walks, I do walk every week--rain or shine. If I can do it, you can do it. Perhaps all you need is a coach to get you started.

One year later and 330.2 miles walked, I am happier, healthier and have a new appreciation for my life and my work. In this time, I have discovered many great paths and would like to invite you to join me in kicking off your own journey of self-discovery. In the process, you will meet new friends, network and push yourself beyond your habitual limits.

Please share this Meetup with friends who are entrepreneurs, small business owners and professionals; your influence could change their lives.
results.name: Hiking With Entrepreneurs/Small Biz Owners/Professionals

results.description:
A Holistic Wellbeing Experience 

Bringing Together What Was Never Meant To Be Apart

Meditation - Exercise – Healthy Eating – Philosophy – Meaningful Connection


“It matters that you make healthy choices every day. It matters that you live your life in the moment. It matters that you love and that you care about becoming the best human being you can be.”


THE PROGRAM  


 PART ONE

·   Be Present - An Inner Moment Experience

05 minute meditation. This is to enhance mindfulness during exercise and conversation.

At the end of the meditation, you will randomly select a piece of paper with a secret phrase or question. This is your mental workout during the exercise session. Later, you will comment about the phrase or question you've received.


PART TWO

· Moving with the Moment.

50 minute Workout. Conditioning and interval training - boot camp style exercise.

You will be going over a circuit routine, a series of bodyweight exercises, from squats to ab work, to resistance band stretch to TRX rows. You will follow your own rhythm, strength and capabilities while I make sure you are motivated and performing the exercises with good form. This routine is tailored to anyone without injuries. 


PART THREE

· Healthy Eating Awareness and Open Discussion of Ethics and “How to Live."

1 hour.

A healthy snack moment: You’re welcome to ask any question about nutrition for weight loss or muscle building. (snack provided)

A philosophical moment: Each member will read the phrase that was given in the beginning of event and be asked to comment on it. The group will be encouraged to explore and expand on this comment. 

P.S. Philosophical conversation is based on Stoicism, but all kind of reflective topics, ideas and questions are welcome!


PART FOUR

· Stay Present Question or Quote

A final reminder to live each and every moment the healthiest way possible.


THE GOAL

Make true connection with the nature of what is important in life:

1- Your physical and mental health.

2- The cultivation of good relationships.

3- The appreciation of beauty in nature and art.

4- The drive and courage to do what is right and healthy for money.

5- Trust the notion that everything happens for a good reason. 


"I believe that LIFE is a compelling gift and that a mysterious CREATOR brought us here to be connected in a meaningful and positive way."  


NOTE: This event is suited for people in the pursuit of holistic wellbeing at all levels of fitness.

I will see you soon!

With strength and warmth,

Valeria

www.FITNESSANDPHILOSOPHY.org
results.name: Fitness and Philosophy Manhattan West Side

results.description:
Travel Chicks ROCK: Transforming the art of travel. One woman at a time. 

Travel Chick: A woman who travels. Unapologetically. Authentically. ABSOLUTELY. Travel Chicks don't just visit a country, we indulge in it. We are not tourists, no ma'am. We want to live as the locals do, leaving no drop of culture behind. Where are we off to next? Who knows! Everywhere is on our list! Passport always at the ready, when it comes to travel, we ROCK! As a group, we are a community of women eager to share knowledge, deals, information and time. Travel Chicks ROCK! is many things to many women, but more than anything, it is a forum, a place for women to discuss, engage and grow, all in the name of the passion that binds us: Travel. Please introduce yourself. Make time to see what there is to see. Join a discussion. Participate in a trip. Dolls, this is our time, our place and our passion. Let's make the most out of it! 

******************************* 

BASIC REQUIREMENTS: 

You must be a woman. Duh. 

Your profile must be in English. 

If you belong to a thousand groups, you will not be approved. This is a community. You can’t be actively involved when you are spread so thin. 

If your profile is a joint profile with your spouse or significant other, you will not be approved. 

If your profile is for a business, not a person, you will not be approved. 

The wait list to join us is LONG. Preference is given to women who a) have been referred by someone in the group; b) have multiple friends in the group; or c) are friends with Danielle (That's me). 

If your profile is one where travel is aggressively marketed, you will likely be denied. 

This group is the extension of a business. Other than the itineraries prepared and sold by Destination By Danielle and hosted by Travel Chicks ROCK!, there is no solicitation is allowed. 

If your profile contains explicit or pornographic content you will not be admitted to the group. It should go without saying, but NO BOYS ALLOWED. Upon request, sir, you will be denied and BLOCKED. 

******************************* 

Travel Chicks ROCK! is a company specializing in group travel for women. As a concierge travel service, we plan every aspect of the group travel experience. Authenticity and immersion are our specialties. Take a moment to take it all in. Join one of our many upcoming trips. You're in great company. 2008 is when it all began. Since then, Travel Chicks ROCK! has taken women from varying backgrounds to destinations around the globe. Initially started as social group to connect women through the common bond of travel, via Facebook and other social media platforms, our community has grown to a membership of thousands of women around the world. We are a movement, coming together locally and globally. We travel authentically and without limits. This is what we do. 

Welcome, Lovely! Your journey starts NOW.

Find us on social media:

www.facebook.com/groups/travelchicksrock

www.twitter.com/travlchicksrock

www.instagram.com/travelchicksrock

www.travelchicksrock.com
results.name: {REAL} Travel Chicks ROCK!

results.description: In each of us has a shaman-hero with unlimited abilities. When you puzzle together your own shaman-hero legend from your personal life-experience, it brings up your primordial skill of self-healing, survival and your uniquely characteristic creativity. Ivan Szendro has been practicing this Self-Made Shamanism since his youth. He was initiated into his knowledge in a village in Hungary during a devastating flood in 1970, and today he and the descendants of that ruined village are rebuilding their new community inspired by their shamanic legend. This mythological communal act today can be an exemplary metaphor for each of us of self-building and self-healing. Join to our shamanic illumination-circle where while each of us can rediscover the unique personal shaman-hero within, just like Ivan did, through our experiences we can find and rebuild our uplifting collective new legend.

This group is for people in their 20s and 30s who live outside of New York City and don't want to trek into the city for every decent outing. This is a group to make new friends for a variety of reasons (maybe you just moved here or maybe all of your old friends are off getting married), it is not a group to make friends for the first time in your life - too many Meetup groups are bogged down by people that have never been social in their lives (in my opinion). results.description: This Meetup is for all of the Brooklyn Writers that are interested in developing a community of peers to read, critique and discuss their work. After graduating from CUNY's Brooklyn College with a BFA in Creative Writing, my peers and I were very good about keeping up a group where we met and discussed each other's pieces weekly. Any writer knows that feedback and critiques from other writers [& likeminded creatives] is essential to a story's progress. Now, 2 years after graduation, our small community has disbanded, and I'm in search of a new one, hoping to unite other fellow writers with the same needs. Writing is a pioneering endeavor--sometimes you can feel like you're alone & in the dark. I'm starting this Meetup to combat that, and hopefully enrich the roots of Brooklyn writers, and encourage us all to grow.

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in achieving financial success. All experience levels are welcome. I started this group to help people achieve their dreams and the financial liberty to give them time to enjoy what is really important in their lives.

Some of the concepts we will be discussing during our meetups:

1. Financial Planning
2. Savings Strategies
3. Retirement Planning
4. College Funding
5. Small Business Management
6. Mortgage
7. Estate creation and conservation
8. Whole Life Insurance
9. Investments in general

What to expect from our meetups:

A debate on specific financial subjects for each meetup. Our sessions will be guided by an experienced financial consultant, but all members will be expected to participate actively during the entire meetup.

Who should join in:

Anyone interested in achieving financial success. Our sessions will give you the opportunity to ask questions, answer questions from other members, share your experience and learn from the experience of other members.

Why should you join:

We discuss about topics that are key for financial success. By participating in our meetups you can learn new tips and improve on your already existing blueprint for your financials.

What can members expect:

At least two meetups per month (locations in Manhattans and Queens to be defined). Sessions open for every member to participate actively in the discussions for the theme of each meetup.

The organizer will provide materials such as presentations and workbooks as part of the sessions, disclosing upfront the source and sponsor for such materials (if any).

Disclosure: the administrator of this meetup is an agent of New York Life working with services related to some of the topics discussed in this meetup group.
results.name: Blueprint for Financial Success Meetup

Hello all,

Welcome to our home on meetup.com! Wolf Pack Events is a global community of gamers who care deeply about the growing world of eSports. Over the last decade, online gaming has become a staple of modern life. Thus, professional gaming has exploded in popularity and is now the fastest growing entertainment genre among young adults globally. The world of eSports is an uncharted, untapped frontier from which we can establish ourselves as early adopters.

Wolfpack Events; who are we? We are an ambitious group of like minded gamers who care deeply about the advancement of this industry and will help spearhead this movement to make eSports synonymous with sports. If you are interested in making new friends, forging professional relationships, and becoming part of this growing industry feel free to join. Currently supported games include: Hearthstone - Starcraft 2 - Overwatch - Heroes of the Storm - Counter Strike - Call of Duty - Dota 2 - League of Legends - Super Smash Bros

Members are eligible for the following meetups: Tournaments / LAN Events - Hearthstone Fireside Gatherings - Industry Trade Shows - Meet the Pros - Pro Gaming Workshops - Impromptu Gaming Sessions - Domestic / International Field Trips - Food & Fellowship.

Activities will include checking out a bar after work or a weekend, having boozy brunch on a Sunday, playing cards/board games or walking around and exploring a neighborhood. Most activities will be small, but there will also be larger group activities like walking the Brooklyn Bridge, exploring Prospect Park, the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens and other hot spots including Brooklyn museums. We may see a game at Barclays or take a short weekend trip excursion. Overall, I want activities to be affordable, or even free.

All skills levels are welcome - especially those completely new to yoga! My classes are a combination of Vinyasa, Hatha and a little restorative depending on the week. results.description:
I am originally form Venezuela and moved to New York last year. Filmmaking is a my passion. Although I haven't been trained in traditional ways, I've had the courage to jump into what in retrospective have been ambitious projects and well, I've learned form my mistakes.

I'm at a point in my life where I want to continue making films, but I want to do so next to people who share my passion, and not just someone who's there to collect a paycheck ( I know it would be ideal to get paid for making films, but at this point I think passion is more important. I'm sure money will comes next ).

I got a few ideas for short films I'd like to produce as well as a pilot for a TV show in Spanish I want to shoot next year (I want to shoot RAW) , but before I carry on, I need the find the right people to work with. I got my my own camera ( Canon 5D Mark iii) and the necessary rig to start making films. Got a passion for filmmaking? You're in the right place. Join this group and let's start making films.

results.description:
The Music Producers Club is a community of musicians inspiring and educating one another.

Join us at the Music Producers Club and experience:

Project Demonstrations
Part of the educational process is being able to ‘peek under the hood’ of
someone's work. We do this by allowing all producers to display their DAW
project files on a projector or big screen, allowing spectators to follow along,
and actually see how the track is composed in addition to hearing it.

Open Sharing
Standard meetings allow artists to share their music, typically in 10-15 minute
slots, where time is devoted to an intro, sharing the core of the track, isolating
and explaining the technique behind specific sections, and finally addressing
questions and feedback.

Live Streaming
It’s the future of education, and we want to set the standard. As meetings are
live streamed, viewers have the ability to tweet or email questions and have
them answered in real time.

Guest Presenters
On special occasions, we bring in a guest presenter to host an open
masterclass and to share their production process from both a creative and
technical perspective. This unique and intimate setting provides a great
opportunity for artists to connect with and educate their fans.

General Networking
Every meeting ends with time for producers to network amongst each other,
and with the guest presenter. Our goal is for the MPC to influence
collaboration allowing producers to continue teaching one another outside
of meetings as well.

To stay tuned in with upcoming meetings and events, join our facebook group:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/nycmusicpro...
results.name: NYC Music Producers Club

results.description:
This group is aimed at helping entrepreneurs navigate the web and answer questions like "how do I know what I don't know. 

People that are a perfect fit for this group are entrepreneurs that like:

• networking

• learning about the web

• like discussing new technologies and software

• are stuck and need some new ideas

• like creative group think situations

Some typical events we like to host are:

• 101 style classes that help people gain mastery

• Networking / mixers that have themes (we like to dress up and have fun)

• Level up sessions where a few people are chosen to present problems and the group helps to try and solve the problem.

• Stump a geek - bring your hardest tech challenges or questions and try to stump Ross 

Ross Lasley (the groups organizer) has personally built over 100,000 websites and has been in the web / e-commerce industry for over 25 years. If it lives on line and it's giving you trouble or you want to know more about it, chances are, he can help. He also like it when people try to stump him, so give me your hardest questions and welcome to the community.

Specifically, Ross enjoys helping people with PCI compliance issues, E-commerce issues and planning, online marketing and generally understanding the web and how it works.

results.description: This Group is for people who always wanted to learn how to dance salsa but didn't know where to begin. We offer affordable classes that are cycle-based and dance socials for students to dance and socialize. The cycles run for 12 weeks and each week's material is based on a syllabus. Each class teaches you the next logical step in the learning process and we practice it thoroughly and review it the next week. That way, even if you missed one class, you will be able to catch up. You are not charged ahead of time. That is, you pay as you go. If you take 1 class, you only pay for that class. This way, you do not have to pay if you missed one class. Classes are affordable and offer a longer duration for the price. That is, Each class is one hour and a half instead of just one hour. You will learn Salsa on2, New York Style, which is what is danced in New York city and other places. So come out and finally learn how to dance salsa. It is great exercise, stress-relieving, educational, brain-stimulating, and incredibly fun. Let's do it!!
results.name: Affordable Salsa Classes for Absolute Beginners

results.description: QiGong, (Chi Kung) and Tai Chi Chuan both involves the study of energy cultivation, movement and control of our body, mind and spirit energies. results.description:
The German-American Hiking Club (GAHC)is an organization of people who share an interest in a German language and culture combined with an appreciation of hiking in the surroundings of metropolitan New York and New Jersey. If you would like to brush up on your German or speak English with hikers of German background, the Club welcomes you.

Since being founded in 1958, the club has scheduled one-day hikes and occasional 3-4 day weekend trips or longer excursions throughout the year. The hikes are mostly easy or moderately difficult.  The Club schedules other outdoor activities such as canoe , or kayak trips or cross-country skiing from time to time.

The printed Hiking Schedule in english, and ( German language version: "Der Wanderplan") is published two times a year, April – September , October - March.

To download the Wanderplan, it is available at:   http://gah.nynjtc.org/

GAHC  maintains a Yahoo group for short notice activities: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/German-American_HC/

There is no guest fee for participation in the first two activities and the fee thereafter is $5 per hike. A guest must participate in two hikes before becoming a member.

Membership dues are $25 annually for individuals, $35 for families.

Hiking club activities involve varying degrees of danger. When you participate in an activity, you should be both physically and mentally prepared and equipped with the appropriate gear. You should always be aware of the risks involved in outdoor activities and conduct yourself accordingly. The trip leader or the German-American Hiking Club is not responsible for your safety. You are. Prior to registering for any activity, you are encouraged to discuss your capabilities with the trip leader.

Hiking shoes and suitable outdoor clothing are required. It is strongly suggested to bring food and drink to the one-day hikes. In case of inclement weather, the hike leader can cancel the hike and may reschedule it for a following weekend at his or her discretion.  Registration for all hikes by 6 PM the evening before is required and hikers are strongly urged to check with the hike leader if the weather looks doubtful or the weather forecast is poor.


Suggested car-pooling fee is recommended at $. 50 per mile, plus tolls, to be shared equally between all passengers and the driver.
results.name: German - American Hiking Club of New York and New Jersey

results.description: I'm a native Astorian who just recently moved back to Astoria/Long Island City (right on the border - Broadway N stop) and am interested in getting together with other homeschooling moms and any/all moms who would like to join. Calling all trailblazing lady bosses in Brooklyn and surrounding areas! If you are looking for a sisterhood of genuine, nice girl-ladybosses, then you've found them. OR if you are looking to start your own business but don't know what to do quite yet...explore in our business club and entrepreneurial girl cave!

About us:

What if being part of a sisterhood where you are inspired daily to learn from each other and consistently given the tools to succeed from experts made all the difference in your life and your businesses? You’re not alone! What if your best friends were the smartest, sweetest, lady bosses around? Would they hook you up with their business connections, share tips, knowledge and mastermind with you to help you up-level your business? Lady Savant Society is a sisterhood and a business camp where fabulous lady bosses up-level their skills, connect and build real friendships. Haven’t you ever wanted a safe place to be an unapologetically awesome, winning woman? We feel like every woman deserves that safe place.

Our mission is to inspire and empower women to turn their businesses and ideas into successful realities by providing a platform for women to learn, connect and collaborate. Savanting Circles are a safe place to brainstorm, share ideas, ask questions and grow in a group of motivated, trailblazing ladies like yourself. I promise you will love it! results.description: This group is for any and all business professionals interested in 3D printing and learning about how it can be implemented in their businesses today and in the future. Although the landscape is changing there's still not enough resources for first time professionals who want to add 3D Printing or Additive Manufacturing into their business workflow. Whether you already have a printer and are simply looking to learn more about use cases or if you are just starting your exploration into 3D printing, this Meetup is for you. For our in-person sessions in NYC, we want everyone to have the chance to get hands-on experience with a 3D printer and focused trainings on how to go from having a great idea to producing a physical object. We offer live webinars as well so those who cannot make our in-person classes can still learn. In our classes we teach members how a 3D printer works, answer questions, and guide them through the process of creating their first print. No supplies, experience or expertise needed. For those looking for more advanced insights into 3D printing we have some of the most knowledgable professionals from across the industry. Our instructors expertise include CAD/CAM Design, Polyjet Technologies, FDM Technologies, and insights on how different businesses from across the world are using 3D printing to prototype, produce, and improve their go-to-market strategies. You should join our group if you are interested in learning about 3D printing, meeting other 3D printing professional users, or generally understanding how 3D printing is being used in different industries today. If you have any projects, ideas or tricks for 3D Printing you'd like to discuss please share them with the group as well! Happy printing!

results.description:
Salsa on 2 Beginners
The Salsa/Mambo basic step is defined by a “quick-quick-slow” to the rhythm of the percussion. The “break step” can be done on any of the 8-beats that of the music. In New York Style Salsa/Mambo, the break step occurs on the 2nd beat of the music, hence the name “On2”! Our Salsa on 2 beginners is designed for students with no prior knowledge or background; an introduction to the look and feel of the dance. Courses will provide instruction and repetition in the basic steps and introduce the importance of the leader/follower connection and Latin motion. Particular attention is paid to timing and musicality. It is recommended that students take this course for two months before moving on.
results.name: One Dance One Conversation - Salsa on 2

Whether you're interested in training to become a better cyclist, or looking to join and make some new friends for casual riding, we have a place for you. results.description: If you're on meetup.com, chances are you know the importance of networking to generate new business. Networking leads to business referrals which are THE fastest way to grow your business. Over 98% of businesses get business from referrals, yet only 3% of those businesses have a plan to consistently get those referrals. Are you ready to join the 3%? For 30 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain." Whether you're new to BNI or have some experience, chances are you've never seen anything like Revenue Raisers before. We're 28 (and growing) highly motivated, enthusiastic and generous professionals that genuinely care about each other and growing each others business from consistent warm referrals. Our members span from fields as diverse as real estate, legal, marketing, finance, and health and wellness. Best of all, we only allow one person per profession. If your profession isn't yet represented in our chapter, you could quickly become the go-to guy or gal. Imagine what having 28+ hungry salespeople looking for new business for you around the clock could do for your business. Are you our next success story? RSVP to our next meeting (Thursdays at 9:30am) and see for yourself how BNI can change your business and your life for the better. Because, who couldn't use a smoking hot referral RIGHT NOW?! Current Location: Park Plaza Restaurant 220 Cadman Plaza West, Brooklyn, NY 11201 Cost: $20/visitor 9:30am-11:00am You will need to bring 50+ business cards to pass to everyone in the room. You will also need to be prepared to tell the room who you are, what you do, and who a perfect referral for you would be. The more specific you are in asking for the referral the greater chance you have in receiving that life changing referral on the spot.

New York AI is a community that brings startups, corporates and academics in the AI sphere together to understand the current state of these technologies, its value add for businesses, and what is in store for the near future. Our talks and round tables aim to reveal trends, industry insights and practicable approaches of applying technologies around the analysis of text, audio, image, video, and structured data.

Each summit not only contains talks providing industry insights, trend analysis, and hands-on tips on how to apply machine learning techniques in your business, it will also have Peer-to-Peer sessions on natural language, audio, image + video analysis, and data modelling led by local industry experts.
results.name: New York AI

results.description: If you love fine art, music and engaging communities through interactive art events then we encourage you to join our group. We use our fine art gallery as a space to promote collaborative innovations, and to create opportunities to come together to create, celebrate and learn together.  We also focus on public art in our community and want to invite you to come share in our multi-cultural events, exhibits and forums. If you have a love of the arts, a belief that art can impact change and growth in community in a positive way and want to meet up with others who share this point of view we invite you to join us. We look forward to getting to know you, and to share and collaborate with you.

results.description: Join us at Bridgeworks Coworking Space in Long Beach, NY to network with other startup entrepreneurs and innovators across every industry. If you're a startup owner, or if you have a great idea for a startup you want to launch, please join us at 780 Long Beach Blvd, Long Beach NY 11561.

results.description:
Let's chat APIs, open source web development, and more at DreamFactory's meetups!

DreamFactory is a free, open source RESTful backend integration platform for mobile, web, and IoT applications. DreamFactory connects to any data source and automatically generates a comprehensive palette of secure, reliable, and customizable REST APIs. Custom API development that used to take weeks or months can now be done with just a few clicks! Learn more about DreamFactory at http://www.dreamfactory.com

Every few months we'll be hosting an event and bringing in speakers from the community. Looking forward to meeting you!
results.name: NYC DreamFactory REST API Group

results.description:
Monday Meals with Friends - Thanks So Much!

Many thanks to all who expressed an interest in Monday Meals with Friends. I'm limiting the group to 50 members, all of whom were added in the chronological order in which they applied. To those who did not presently get in, please check back occasionally - membership will change as those who express their lack of interest by not attending a dinner at least once in eight weeks will be deleted. This group is about friendship more than food and drink, and the membership will surely ebb and flow over time as new friendships are formed and others not realized. It's simply the nature of human connection, hits and misses and no one's at fault, so please do check this site in the future. So very many lovely people were simply over the numerical limit.  I hope you all stop by again and we get to meet at a later date.

Best wishes, and thank you again for your interest.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You've had a great - or maybe not so great - weekend, and now a long week stretches ahead. Why not ease into that long week with a nice, relaxing meal at a warm and inviting restaurant, surrounded by friends, laughter, and good conversation?

 This group is for those 40 and over seeking good company, good food, and a good evening out, on the otherwise most neglected night of that week. Our venues will be primarily in mid to eastern Nassau and western Suffolk, an area dense with charming, welcoming, and unique restaurants, pubs, and cafes. New locations and suggestions will always be welcome. 

A little food to nourish the body, a little conversation to warm the heart, a little companionship to soothe the soul. Good food and good friends - what better way to start the week?
results.name: Monday Meals with Friends

results.description:
Woman 24-35 who enjoy a great read and a glass of wine (or beer, etc.) Meetings will be held on the third Wednesday of every month at a local spot. (Middlesex County) Since this is a brand new group the first few members will chose the book for each month but are open to suggestions from all! If your looking for a nice night out, make some great friends and discuss some great reads, this is the book club for you!

Fun Facts

-It's not necessary that you finish the book by the meetup, but be prepared for some spoilers!

-Most meet ups will be held at a restaurant of some type so feel free to come hungry.

-We're really a very fun and friendly group, so if you're on the fence, give us a shot!

Ground Rules:

-Members who don't attend a meetup after RSVP-ing yes and failing to change their RSVP to no will be removed after three such "no-shows."

-Inactive members (not in attendance at any meetups) will be removed after 6 months of inactivity.

results.description: Are you a working creative freelancer, designing mostly at home or from your studio? Thinking it would be nice to be working separately, but around other creatives who love art and design? Then this group is for you. A once a week meetup in public venues with wi-fi, starting at 10 am, come for as long or as short as you would like and bring your computer or tablet or whatever you need to work on your jobs... THIS IS FOR WORKING ESTABLISHED CREATIVES ONLY.. a way of meeting other established freelancers. Places where you can get a cup of coffee, maybe even grab lunch. If 5-10 working creatives are interested, I'll set a place each week (and take suggestions as well). PLEASE - for working professionals only...no students or those trying to "break in".
results.name: New York Creative Freelancers Meetup 40-60 yr olds

results.description:
This is a heterosexual group of single adults designed to cater exclusively to those over 50 that desire to meet and form friendships outside of their own race in the comforting, non judgmental atmosphere of naturism. Initially the group will be limited to Caucasian women and Afro American men and women as this seems to be a nearly IMPOSSIBLE group to establish. I don't think I've ever actually seen an Afro American woman at a nudist camp. We need to change this! If successful, we will broaden the invite to include others. Both nudism and clothing optional is permitted. There is a dearth of groups that cater specifically to the over 50's crowd that enjoy both the concept behind naturism, and when they exist, they are horribly segregated by race and gender and usually over represented by white Caucasian men. Hence my brilliant idea for this group. :) 

Oftentimes, older people feel intimidated by younger, fitter nude bodies and hopefully this group will offer a welcome alternative to that atmosphere. No body judging in this group! Naturism is about celebrating the loveliness of us all and how the variations inspire awe and respect. All types are welcome as long as they are honest, fun loving and most important- intelligent. This group has absolutely nothing to do with sexuality. To anyone conversant with naturism, nudity is anything but sexual. It brings everyone down to the same, happy level of openness, vulnerability and sharing.

Activities will be both indoors and out, weather permitting, and are all about socializing. Beyond that dinner and house parties, potlucks, game playing, body painting, trips to nudist beaches, backyard BBQ's, etc. All members must be approved by the organizer. The questionnaire must be filled out with thoughtful, extensive answers as to why you think you would fit in this group. Single words or three word sentences will be declined. It must be obvious from your responses that you are an intelligent, educated person seeking to contribute in a meaningful way to the group. All applicants must have a very legible recent photo of themselves and must show proof of age. We are determined to keep the group gender balanced. Now let's have fun!
results.name: Interracial over 50's nudism

results.description: This group is for Entrepreneurs who currently run their Ecommerce Stores on shopify platform and people who want to learn about owning one themselves. I currently run my store on shopify. I find that it is very simple to setup, even if I am not a coder, I pretty much can set it up myself and hope to Share my knowledge with people out there and hopefully help them with a question or two. I hope to meet fellow store owners that we can share ideas with.

results.description:
A Marketing StackUp is an event where marketing leads of a pre-screened set of companies show off what they do and how they do it - from a tech point of view. Get an inside look into how New York City startups develop their dev strategy. At each marketing stackup, we feature 3-5 speakers showing off their marketing stack. It's a great opportunity to learn what others are working on in the marketing scene, meet like-minded people, and learn something new. Some of our previous speakers from past events have included Squarespace, Oscar, LiveIntent. Soon to come are Harry's, Stack Overflow, The Muse, Facebook, and many more.

Looking forward to having you as part of our community and seeing you at some of our next stackup talks!

Code of Conduct
Our events are dedicated to providing a positive experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or technology choices. We do not tolerate harassment or disrespect towards event participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any event venue, including talks, related workshops, parties, Twitter, and other online media. Participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled from the event at the discretion of the conference organizers.
results.name: Marketing StackUp Talks - Marketing Professionals Only

results.description: Let's get together to share ideas about real estate! There's unlimited opportunity to make money investing in real estate as people will always need a place to live or property to house their businesses. This group is designed for anyone interested in real estate investing, mentorship and/or expanding their business network. Our goal is to provide you with all of the training and tools you need to be a successful real estate investor through weekly training orientations, cash flow games, networking events, workshops and so much more. It doesn't matter if you're new to real estate or seasoned in the business, all is welcome to join the group! There's something for everyone to gain from our network of successful and wealthy real estate investors.

results.description: Creating and impactful, supportive community empowering people with disabilities and those who care about and for them. results.description:
ZogSports is America's most popular CoEd social sports league. Whether you just moved to New York City, looking to meet people outside of your office, bored, or looking for an excuse to have a great time with your existing friends, ZogSports Football is the best mix of sport and social!

You need something that works for you, so we offer multiple levels of competition and we play in different locations throughout Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Queens. We have leagues on multiple days of the week, so we'll find something to fit your schedule. There's a happy hour after every game, so it's a great way to socialize with your team and mingle with the other teams.

Your time is valuable, so we'll give you your full season's schedule before the first game. We have a rigorous hiring and training process for all of our referees, to ensure that games run smoothly.

We actually care about your experience, so we dedicated full time staff whose sole responsibility is making sure your league runs well. You can make a special request for your schedule or team when you sign up and we work our hardest to accommodate all of them. If you don't have enough people for a full team, you can sign up with a few friends or as a free agent and we'll place you on a fun team with other people in a similar skill level.

Questions? Just ask!
results.name: NYC Flag and Touch Football Players

results.description: Corporate wellbeing programs improve employee engagement, which gives a boost to company performance. What are important factors for wellbeing programs? What is their ROI? How does employee engagement work and how can we influence it? These are some of the questions we are planning to investigate in this group through a regular series of presentations by various speakers from within the HR and coaching field as well as corporate wellbeing providers. Each presentation will be followed by up to 90 minutes of networking and group discussions about Corporate wellbeing, employee engagement and related HR best practices.

results.description:
Hi there, my name is Alan and I created this group hoping to find other people like me who are free to do fun activities during the day on weekdays. 

Going to matinee shows with no lines and having the whole theater to yourself; trying the lunch specials at good, hard-to-get-in restaurants; seeing your favorite celebrities at live tapings of talk shows—these are just some of the great things that NYC has to offer during the day. And what better way to enjoy them than with good company!

If you're among the fortunate people who have free time during the weekday and would like to make new friends with similar schedules—maybe a tennis partner, or a fellow foodie, or someone to collaborate with on your next project—then this group is for you.

I look forward to meeting you!
results.name: 9 to 5 Friends
